She currently works as a garment worker for a factory located near her house. The other source of the family's income comes from her husband's salary of $70 a month. He works as a local military policeman. Since her roof is cracking during the rainy season, S. has decided to seek a loan in order to repair it.

The other four borrowers are: P. is a fruit seller, who is applying for a loan to expand her business. S. is a staff member for an association and she is looking for a loan to finish building her house. S. is a garment worker, who is requesting a loan to buy a used motorbike for riding to work. S. works as a seamstress in a garment factory and she is applying for a loan to purchase a motorbike to ride to work. All of the borrowers are people living in Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To repair the old roof of a house

loans.name: Alberto Jose

texts.es: El señor Alberto José González , tiene la edad de 48 años, habita en el barrio Pilas Orientales , ubicado en la ciudad de Masaya , junto a su esposa , ella le apoya en los trabajos agrícolas y tres veces por semana vende en el mercado ; ellos tiene siete hijos , ya todos casado e independientes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Alberto desde hace cinco años , se dedica al trabajo de campo , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y en ocasiones se ha visto afectado por la sequilla .Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder tener una buena cosecha y pueda vender a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Mr. Alberto José González is 48 years old and lives with his wife in the Pilas Orientales neighborhood of Masaya. His wife helps him with his agricultural work and goes to the market three times a week to sell their products. They have seven adult children who are all married. Mr. Alberto would like to improve living conditions for his family. He has been farming for five years and finds that the most difficult part is lack of money. He has also had some problems with drought. He will buy fertilizers and supplies with the loan money to put on his crops so he will get a good harvest and be able to sell it at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar insumos y fertilizantes para mejorar al cultivo

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 42 years old, married, and the mother of three children: two are independent and the younger ones are currently in school.

Lydia is trader, dealing in lace materials, textiles and clothing materials. Lace materials are very useful in room and office decorations. Lydia mostly sells through hawking (going door-to-door). She says hawking makes her clothing materials move very fast.

For lack of adequate working capital, Lydia buys only a small stock of lace materials and sells through hawking. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. With the loan, she wants to purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk.

Lydia hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with a quality education. She belongs to a village bank called “Aver Maria”.

loans.use: To purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es: Mariluz tiene 38 años, es una madre amorosa, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 2 hijas Teresa de 18 y Roció de 15 años, a quienes desea darles buenos estudios superiores. Ella es dueña de una combi (camioneta), la cual trabaja en una empresa de transportes que brinda servicio urbano y Mariluz es la encargada de cobrar los pasajes en dicho transporte, de paso que aprovecha para estar siempre vigilando que no le pase nada a su carro, ya que puso todos los ahorros que tenía para su compra. Lleva 4 años realizando este trabajo y lo que más le gusta es bromear con los pasajeros, para que los largos recorridos sean más amenos, pero lo que menos le gusta es tener que levantarse temprano para salir a ganar pasajeros, aun así no decae en su afán de continuar con sus sueños y alcanzar sus metas. Para un futuro cercano espera comprar otra combi para que también trabaje en transporte. Este es el tercer préstamo de Mariluz con MFP, está muy feliz de la oportunidad de crédito y sabe que tiene que invertir el dinero en su negocio, para que sea más productivo. Los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en comprar nuevas llantas para su combi, ya que con el paso del tiempo se han ido desgastando.
texts.en:
Mariluz is a 38-year-old loving mother who lives in her own house with her two daughters, 18-year-old Teresa and 15-year-old Roció, for whom she wants to give the best educational opportunities. Mariluz is the owner of a van she uses for her work with an urban transportation company. She is responsible for charging passengers for this transportation and always makes sure she is vigilant that nothing happens to her car, since she’s put all of her savings into its purchase. She has been doing this work for the past four years and what she likes most is joking with the passengers so that the longer routes are more pleasant. What she likes the least is that she has to wake up early to leave and pick up passengers, but despite this, her efforts to continue reaching for her dreams and achieving her goals have not declined. In the near future she hopes to purchase another van to also use for transportation. This is the third loan that Mariluz requests with MFP and is very happy to receive the opportunity to get credit and knows that she needs to invest the money in her business in order to be more productive. The 3000 soles she requests will go to the purchase of new tires for her van since time has caused them to wear out.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase tires for her van

loans.name: Saili

texts.en:
Saili T. is forty-two years old and married with eight school-age children.  To make a living, Saili works in a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops.  The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting bananas to sell.  Saili has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately $170 a month from these activities.

In 2003, Saili joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities.  Saili has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2650 WST from SPBD.  That loan was used to rent land to raise additional crops.  Saili is now requesting a new loan of 3400 WST which will be used to purchase land.  This will be her fourth loan from SPBD.  Saili plans to use the additional revenue to further improve her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase land for additional crops

loans.name: Oco

texts.en:
Oco N. is from the village of El Salvador, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Oco is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Oco owns and operates a business butchering and selling pork and chicken  meat in the market. Oco has been in business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Oco joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oco is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Oco from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yinusa

texts.en:
Yinusa rents tables and chairs. She is 43 years old and married with four children. She has been in the business since 1998.

Yinusa hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more tables and chairs to rent. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tables and chairs to rent

loans.name: Jecelyn

texts.en:
Jecelyn I. is from the village of Calaca-an. She is 29 years old. Jecelyn is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Jecelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Jecelyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jecelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jecelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Jecelyn is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jecelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nao

texts.en: Nao N., 51, is a hard working woman, and currently works as a professional silk weaver. She has six married and four single children, while her husband is a construction worker. Nao N. requests a loan in order to support her current investment. She will buy more materials to continue weaving.

loans.use: To buy more materials to continue weaving

loans.name: Ghislaine Francisca

texts.fr: La cliente est née vers 1977 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants dont un est scolarisé. Elle assure avec son conjoint les charges de la famille. Elle est allée à l'école jusqu'au secondaire. Il y a quatre ans que la cliente s'est mise à vendre des tissus, des produits de beauté et aussi des glacières, des plastiques et des bassines. C'est à Lomé au Togo, État voisin du Bénin, et à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, qu'elle s'approvisionne. Elle avait bénéficié de deux crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. C'est pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et agrandir davantage son activité qu'elle sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The client was born around 1977 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She is married and has two children, one of whom attends school. She and her husband both work to support the family financially. She was a student until high school. Four years ago, the client began selling fabric, beauty products, ice chests, and plastic basins. She purchases goods for resale in Lomé, Togo (a neighboring country) and in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She has previously had two loans from ALIDé, which she successfully repaid. She will use this third loan to increase her working capital and expand her business.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric and beauty products

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier tiene 41 años, es soltero y vive en su casa acompañado de sus mascotas. Con mucho esmero y dedicación trabaja en sus cultivos de plátanos y café. Cada 5 años  renueva sus plantas de plátanos, porque las hojas amarillas no son signos de una buena producción. Adicionalmente, trabaja como operario en las chacras de sus vecinos y cuando lo buscan para algún trabajo, no lo llaman por su nombre, sino que graciosamente gritan su apodo, “Capulina”. Javier es muy buscado para las faenas del macheteo porque realiza un buen trabajo, además es muy cumplidor y responsable. Por su trabajo cobra entre 15 a 18 soles diarios, con ello y las ganancias de sus propios cultivos puede vivir holgadamente.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, siendo muy puntual en sus pagos, además le complace las reuniones de su banco comunal porque todos son muy alegres y bromistas. El dinero que ahora solicita es para que la compra de plantitas de plátanos, ya piensa renovar dichos cultivos.
texts.en:
Javier is 41 years old, is single and lives in his home with the company of his pets. With a lot of work and dedication, he cares for his crops of bananas and coffee. Every 5 years he replants his baN. plants because the yellow leaves are not a good sign of good production. Additionally, he is a workman in his neighbor’s small farms and when they need him for a job they don’t call him by his given name, but call him by his nickname “Capulina.” Javier is very sought after to work with the machete because he does a good job since he is very reliable and responsible. For his job, he charges between 15 and 18 soles daily, and with that and his profits from his own crops, he lives a comfortable life.

This is his second loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner), he is very punctual with his payments. What's more, he enjoys the meetings with his communal bank because everyone is very joyful and good-humored. The money will be used to buy small baN. plants, and thinks of renovating the aforementioned crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy banana plants.

loans.name: Victoire

texts.fr: S. Victoire est née vers 1961 à Dogbo au Bénin. Victoire réside depuis environs 18 ans au quartier Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à SESSOU Richard un cuisinier, Victoire est mère de six enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Victoire vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Seul le mari assure les charges de la famille. Victoire n’a pas été à l’école. C’est depuis 18 ans que Victoire vend des céréales (riz, maïs, haricot blanc et rouge, etc.) en face de l’Ecole Primaire Publique de Cadjèhoun. Victoire mène comme activité secondaire, la vente de citron et de sachets. Victoire s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Adja au Mono au Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. En vue d’accroître le revenu de son activité et de l’grandir davantage, Victoire sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Victoire envisage plus tard, acquérir sa propre parcelle.
texts.en:
S. Victoire was born around 1961 in Dogbo in Benin. She has been residing for eighteen years in the Cadjèhoun district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to SESSOU Richard, a cook, she is the mother of six children who are all in school. She lives together with her children and husband. The husband alone ensures that family expenses are covered. Victoire did not go to school. For eighteen years, she has been selling grains (rice, corn, white and red beans, etc.) opposite the Ecole Primaire Publique de Cadjèhoun. She runs a secondary business selling lemons and baggies. She stocks up on supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and in Adja in Mono, in Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client who repays her loans. With the aim of growing her business revenues and expanding her business further, she's requesting a third loan from ALIDé. Victoire envisions acquiring her own parcel of land later on.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grains (sacks of rice, beans, and corn)

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina C. D. F. D. 54 años D. edad, resiD. en Ciudad Arce en el departamento D. La Libertad. Ella vive junto a su esposo D. 65 años D. edad y su nieto D. 16 años. Catalina es una mujer muy fuerte la cual es conocida por ser responsable y buena persona, muy colaboradora y solidaria con los demás. Ella posee una venta D. tortillas la cuales las elabora y comercializa al mediodía, las tortillas son un alimento básico dentro D. los platillos salvadoreños, es por esto que se venden en cualquier lugar del país y cuenta con mucha demanda. La señora Catalina, solícita un préstamo con el fin D. poder comprar maíz para la elaboración D. las tortillas, todo esto lo hace con el deseo D. contar con más material para poder vender más su producto y así mejorar sus ventas y contribuir junto a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Catalina C. D. F., 54, lives in Ciudad Arce, which is in La Libertad department, with her 65-year-old husband and her 16-year-old grandson. Catalina is a strong woman who is known for being a responsible and good person; very cooperative and helpful to others. She makes tortillas for sale at noon. Tortillas are a basic element of Salvadoran dishes so they are sold all over the country and are in high demand. Catalina is requesting funding to buy corn for her tortillas. She does all this hoping to have more supplies with which to increase production so that her sales will improve and, together with her husband, be able to cover household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn.

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Islamudin

texts.en:
This young man is Islamudin, the son of N.. He is 32 and married. He has two children, a son and a daughter, and both of them are school students. 
He is a hard working man who really works to support his wife and his children. 
He is a well digger. He works and digs the wells with the help of a machine. 
He would like to take an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani to buy the essential equipment needed to progress and expand his business.
He would like to extend his gratitude to all lenders, especially Kiva lenders, who support the entrepreneurs around Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy essential equipment for his business

loans.name: Maribel  Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Maribel  del Carmen M. R., de 30 años de edad habita en  el barrio Pilas orientales, es casada y su esposo se desempeña como guarda de seguridad, el cual le brinda un aporte mensual para los gastos del hogar, en los tiempos libres le apoya en los trabajos agrícolas, ellos tiene 3 hijos entre las edades de 12, 10, 8, los hijos estudian la escuela primaria, la familia ha considerado la posibilidad de emprender un negocio de venta de carnes, estos planes serian a un futuro inmediato, pero para poder idealizar esto la señora M. que se dedica al cultivo de la piña, desea invertir este capital a la finca en la compra  cultivos mejorados, tales como fertilizantes, con el objetivo de mejorar el manejo agronómico a su cultivo, con esta ayuda la señora Maribel podría realzar la ideas de abrir su propio negocio el que les traería mejores condiciones económicas para toda la familia.
texts.en:
Señora Maribel del Carmen M. R., 30, lives in the Pilas Orientales area. She is married, and her husband works as a security guard, providing the monthly income for household expenses. In his free time he helps with the farm work. They have 3 children ages 12, 10 and 8, attending primary school. The family is considering the possibility of opening a meat-selling business in the near future, but in order to realize this, Señora M., who grows pineapples, needs to invest capital in the farm for improved crops and fertilizers, with the goal of improving the agricultural management of their farm. With this help, Señora Maribel will be able to open her own business, which will bring better economic conditions to the whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural supplies

loans.name: Jou-Ann

texts.en: Jou-ann is a member of CEVI. She is 21 years old, married, and has two children. Her older child is only 2 years old. She chose to be a member of CEVI because of its 2% interest rate. She said that as a farmer, proper financing is necessary. She is thankful she is able to access CEVI’s financial service. She used her previous loans to fund the farm that she tends. She would like now to request Php 14,000. This loan will be used in buying farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Mary Ann's Group

texts.en:
Mary Ann M. is from the village of Balatacan, Tangub City. She is 36 years old. Mary Ann is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Mary Ann is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Ann owns & operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mary Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Mary Ann from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sevinc

texts.en:
Sevinc I. was born in 1986. She is single. This young woman is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, who is now settled in the Absheron region.

She has been in this business for 2 years. Now she needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy a computer and books.

loans.use: To buy a computer and books

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary sells honey at retail prices to her customers. She is 30 years old and married with four children. She is the only person in her community that does this business. She is well known in her community and this gives her high patronage. Honey is used in Nigeria for a lot of things like marriage and making herbal medicines. 

Mary hopes to grow her business. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more honey to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more honey to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia S. is from the village of  Digkilian, Iligan City. She is 48 years old. Lilia is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lilia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline C. hails from Kakamega. She is single and has one child aged eight years old whom she hopes to educate to college level.

Caroline’s business is located at Kakamega in a busy market. She gets tenders from the local schools and makes school uniforms, petticoats and sweaters. She has been in this business for the last ten years and she says she likes it so much, even though it is very seasonal.

Caroline is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more materials to expand her business. She is very hardworking and describes herself as ambitious and patient.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 65 years old. He is married with six children between 19 and 38 years old. One of his children currently attends school.

He is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya. He has been practising mixed farming for over 25 years. He mainly produces bananas, tea, and milk which he sells to the local market and Kenya Tea Development Authority. His main challenge is lack of enough skills in dairy farming.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 45000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The loan will enable him to acquire a good dairy cow that will produce enough milk for family consumption and sale. The extra income will also enable him to pay school fees for his children. In the future he would like to start his own business and own 3 quality dairy cows for milk production.

He is asking for Juhudi to continue supporting him financially and to train him on modern skills in dairy farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jose Arturo

texts.es:
El señor Arturo es el único caballero que integra el Banco Comunal Mujeres Del Futuro que se reúnen en la ciudadela Las Orquídea perteneciente al cantón Portoviejo, nuestro socio Se dedica al comercio de productos de plásticos y papel como: tarrinas, platos, fundas  y todo lo relacionado con productos de estos materiales, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace un año y empezó en el puerto de Manta ya que el vive ahí,  justamente ahora ha extendido su negocio al cantón Portoviejo y le va muy bien, el objetivo de el es poder extender sus ventas a otros cantones.

Arturo esta casado, tiene dos hijos adolecentes que le ayudan en el  negocio,  ellos se encargan de hacer la entrega de los productos a tiendas, restaurantes y panaderías; se inicio en  este  trabajo porque su suegro lo tenia, pero cuando murió le dejo a la hija el negocio y ellos lo continuaron, reunió algo de dinero y lo surtió, ha tenido éxito en sus ventas. Con este nuevo crédito el señor Arturo podrá invertir en comprar mas productos para su negocio, a la vez quiere emprender algo nuevo que seria la venta de cortinas, sabanas y manteles, este tema lo ha tratado con su esposa y esta de acuerdo, para  así poder seguir manteniendo a su familia.  Viajara a comprar la mercadería a Quito y Guayaquil.

 La entrega de pedidos lo hace en su vehículo personal; esta muy satisfecho con la ayuda que recibe de la Fundación.
texts.en:
Mr. Arturo is the only man who is a member the "Mujeres del Futuro" ("Women of the Future") Communal Bank, which meets in the Las Orquídea neighborhood, in the canton of Portoviejo. Arturo sells paper and plastic products like: tubs, plates, bags, and everything related to products of those materials. He has been doing this for a year now. He started in the Puerto de Manta neighborhood since he lives there, and just recently he has expanded his service to the canton of Portoviejo. It's going very well and his goal is to extend his service to other cantons. Arturo is married and has two adolescent children who help him with the business. They are responsible for delivering products to stores, restaurants, and bakeries. He got started in this work because it was his father-in-law's business, and when he died, he left the business to his daughter. Arturo and his wife have continued the business. He got together some money, stocked up, and has had success with their sales. With this new loan, Mr. Arturo will be able to invest in the purchase of more products for his business. At the same time, he'd like to try something new, which will be the sale of curtains, sheets, and tablecloths. He has discussed this with his wife and she agrees with him, because this way, they will be able to continue supporting their family. He will travel to Quito and Guayaquil to purchase the merchandise. He delivers orders with his personal vehicle. He is very satisfied by the support he receives from the Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags, jars, cups, plates, tablecloths, curtains, etc.

loans.name: May Anneliez

texts.en:
May Anneliez D. is from the village of Dolores, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 and married with four adult children. To make a living, May Anneliez owns a general store selling a variety of different products. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, May Anneliez joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC which was used to to purchase additional products to sell and is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by May Anneliez from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia T., 42, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Joseph T., an OFW (overseas Filipino worker), and the mother of three children, one of whom is in college, while the other two are in high school and elementary school. By the grace of God, Virginia has managed to support her older child's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send the other two to college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Virginia, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Virginia maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct-selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and the difference makes up the profits that dealers are counting on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She averages a minimum of 200 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Virginia dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year.

loans.use: to buy orders for her customers

loans.name: Tuvshinsaihan

texts.en:
Tuvshinsaihan B. is 29 years old and lives with his wife and child in the Hovd province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. 

Tuvshinsaihan is a teacher; however, he also operates a taxi service between Hovd city and the Buyant sub-province. He began his business in 2007 and has gained a lot of experience since then. He is requesting a 1,200,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase parts to repair his car.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with seven children whom all attend school. She has been operating her food stall business for the last three years. She also sells from home to her neighbors and school going children. With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase a bundle of maize flour, a sack of rice and beans. She has no other source of income.

She faces the challenges of high prices of food stuff and high competition. She hopes to be self reliant in the future and become a restaurant operator. She decided to work with Yehu to get financial assistance to boost her business. She lives at her own house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of maize flour, a sack of rice and beans.

loans.name: Claudia Yesenia

texts.es: La señora Claudia es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella es empleada domestica y su esposo el Señor Juan, trabaja como obrero en una maquiladora, la señora Claudia se preocupa por la educación de sus hijos y requieren de este crédito para los útiles escolares de sus dos hijos, que están próximos a empezar el ciclo escolar. Ellos son una familia muy unida. La señora Claudia les agradece mucho el apoyó que le puedan brindar.
texts.en:
Claudia is a very hard working woman. She is a domestic employee and her husband, Juan, works as a laborer at an assembly plant. Claudia is concerned about her children’s education and needs this loan to buy school supplies for her two sons who are about to start the new school term. The family is very cohesive. Claudia very much appreciates whatever support she can get.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her children's education.

loans.name: Karukara Women's B, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
K. Jolly of Karukara Women's group, Kihihi, aged 51 years, is a married mother of 7 children. She has been operating a retail shop from Kagongi trading centre, Kihihi, selling general merchandise for over 8 years. This is the business she started after leaving her previous farming enterprise.

She trades in a variety of products for domestic use like sugar, soap, salt, cooking oil, paraffin and much more earning her 120,000 Ugandan shillings weekly. 

Her main drawback is that she has limited stock of products in her shop that cannot satisfy the customers' demand. Therefore Jolly is looking forward to increasing the stock in her business when she gets this loan and also expands into a wholesale shop. This will help her earn more revenue and sustain her daily needs as she envisions improving her family’s standard of living and further educating her children.

All group members hold one another accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Mburucuyá Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina ”Mburucuyá“ están en el Octavo Ciclo con 15 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable entre ellas.
Las mismas trabajan en grupo y como tienen una responsabilidad conjunta decidieron  trabajar para contar con ahorros y de esa manera facilitar el pago de las cuotas que tienen cada una de las señoras, y actualmente cuentan con una buena cantidad de ahorro.
La Sra. Mónica quien es una de las integrantes de grupo se dedica a la venta de lencería, ropa interior femenina, así como medias, tohallas, etc.
Tiene buena clientela, la cual va en aumento, por los años que se dedica a este rubro y gracias a su gentileza y esfuerzo.
Comenta que la menera mas facil de vender a sus clientes es acercando la mercaderias hasta ello y ella recurre a esta tecnica por que muchas horas del dia a ofrecer sus prendas, y de esa forma consigue vender gran cantidad de sus mercaderias.
Ademas comenta que este ingreso le ayuda especialmente para la alimentacion de la familia.
 Ella desea ampliar el negocio mediante la adquisición de mas variadas prendas para damas, como son de marcas diferentes, colores, tamaños y teniendo en cuenta el inicio de temporada primaV.-verano, desea invertir en compras al por mayor de modo a abaratar precios de costo y así obtener más ingresos con la venta.
texts.en:
The "Mburucuya" group is in its 8th loan cycle and has 15 members. As a group, they are known in their neighborhood for being very close-knit, group-minded, and responsible. They work as a group and since they have a joint responsibility, they decided to work to have savings. In this way, they are able to facilitate each woman's repayments, and they now have a good amount of savings. Ms. Mónica, who is a member of the group, sells lingerie and women's undergarments, as well as hosiery, towels, etc. She has a good clientele, which has grown through the years she has dedicated to this business, and thanks to her effort and gentle nature. She notes that the easiest way to sell to her customers is by bringing the merchandise to them, and she employs this method for many hours each day, in order to offer her merchandise. In this way, she manages to sell a great amount of her merchandise. She also comments that this investment has been especially helpful in feeding her family. Ms. Mónica hopes to expand her business by acquiring a greater variety of garments for women, such as different brands, colors, and sizes, and by also having in mind that the spring-summer season is beginning. She would like to invest in making wholesale purchases so that her costs will go down and she can therefore obtain better profits on sales.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to acquire wholesale merchandise such as undergarments for women

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina P. is a married woman who lives in Bliss, Brgy. La Paz, Bogo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: a general store and curtain sales. Her husband, Gaspar Jupiter P., 44 years old, works overseas to earn his living. They have 1 child who is 16 years old. Gina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 which she intends to use as additional working capital for her general store and curtain sales business so that she can continue to save up for her daughter's future education. Gina P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Olouwafemi Rosine

texts.fr: O. Olouwafemi Rosine est née le 11 Septembre 1981 et est mariée à IFOUWEMI Mathias. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille s'est installée au quartier Agbato à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis trois ans. Le couple se partage les différentes charges du ménage. Rosine a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire et a appris ensuite la coiffure. Parallèlement à cette activité qu'elle mène passionnément, Rosine vend des mèches et divers produits cosmétiques dans son salon de coiffure. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi au Nigéria que Rosine achète ses produits. Rosine a déjà obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé et a bien remboursé ledit crédit. Face à la demande de plus en plus grandissante de sa clientèle, Rosine souhaite renforcer davantage son activité et accroître son chiffre d'affaire ; raison pour laquelle Rosine sollicite un autre crédit.
texts.en: Oulouwafemi Rosine O. was born on September 11, 1981. She is married to Mathias Ifouwemi. The couple has two children, both of whom go to school. The family settled in the Agbato district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, three years ago. The spouses jointly take care of various household expenses. Rosine stopped her studies at the secondary level and later learned the hairdresser’s trade. In addition to  being a hairdresser who is passionate about her work, she also sells hair extensions and various cosmetic products in her beauty salon. Rosine stocks up in Dantokpa, at the international market of Benin, as well as in Nigeria. Rosine already obtained a loan from ALIDé in the past and repaid it well. Facing the ever growing customer demand, Rosine would like to strengthen her business and increase her revenues, which is why she is seeking another loan.

loans.use: Purchasing hair extensions and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Flores de Vilquechico” ubicado en el distrito de Vilquechico, provincia de Huancané, departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil separada y con 03 hijos, tiene estudios de educación secundaria.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 01 año, con un préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de golosinas, gaseosas y biscochos; también se dedica a la venta de animales menores.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar mercaderías para su negocio de venta de golosinas.
	
Su sueño es techar su casa y comprar un carro para trasladar el ganado.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the community bank "Las Flores de Vilquechico" (The Flowers of Vilquechico), located in the Vilquechico district in the province of Huancané and the department of Puno. She is 32 years old, is separated, and has 3 children. She has some secondary education.

She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos since a year ago, when she got a loan of 500 PEN, money that helped her increase her working capital for her business of selling candy, soft drinks, and bread. She also sells small animals.

Now she is applying for a new loan of 500 PEN, which she will use to buy merchandise for her candy business.

Her dream is to put a roof on her house and to buy a car to transport the animals.

What she likes most about her community bank are the punctuality and responsibility shown by the other members.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her son in his business of selling betel leaves and cigarettes. He operates a small shop in the main market where he sells these products to his clients and earns a profit. He keeps different brands of cigarettes in his shop to fulfill the timely needs of his customers. He has been doing this business for the past 8 years and has obtained a good reputation. With the loan, he will buy betel leaves and cigarettes in bulk quantity for his shop. 
  
Sakina herself is a housewife who stays at home and does her household work. She lives with her family in a two-room brick house in the city of Riwind. It is a small city and known for its dairy industry in Pakistan. She moved here after her marriage. Her husband’s name is A. A., and he is above 55 years and doesn’t work.  

Sakina is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.  Sakina is hopeful that with the loan investment, her son will successfully be able to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy betel leaves & cigarettes for reselling

loans.name: Maria Regina

texts.es: Maria Regina tiene 30 años, vive en su casa propia, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Ella ofrece a sus amigas los productos necesarios y dice que aunque sus ganancias son regulares le sirven apara ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Su actividad es la venta y compra de ropa nueva. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene pensado mejorar su actividad. Ella tiene tiempo de trabajar con Fundación y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente como siempre ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Maria tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de faldas, camisas, pantalones, vestidos entre otros.
texts.en: Maria Regina is 30 years old.  She lives in her own home and has two dependent children in her care.  She offers her friends all the products they need.  She says that her profits are regular and allow her to help her husband with their household expenses.  Her business activity is buying and selling new clothes.  As she is a very enterprising woman, in the future she plans to improve her business.  She has been working with Fundación for some time and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner, as she always does, since she doesn't want to let down the people who have made this support possible because it will help her to continue working in search of progress.  Maria plans to invest her loan in buying skirts, shirts, pants, dresses, etc.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis K. is an individual client from Kyenjojo. He is 34 years old and married, and he has 6 children. He is a very hard-working man. He has a business selling produce and making and selling waragi, a local brew from Kijugu. He has been in this business for 12 years and he is able to make 1,400,000/= (Kenyan shillings) in profits each week. 

He sells mostly to bars, grocers, and individuals. He started this business because he believed it was profitable and, indeed, it is. His future plan is to continue selling produce and waragi and to open a big store in Kyenjojo. So far, he has bought plots of land as one of his properties.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for making waragi, a local brew.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice B. is 44 years old business lady in Kisimani. She is a widow and a mother of four children. She has been in the tailoring and boutique business for the last five years. 

This being her first loan from KADET, she plans to purchase more materials for making new clothes, and buy some new clothes for the boutique. The anticipated profits she will pay school fee for her children. Beatrice’s dreams and hopes for the future is to own a rental car company.

loans.use: purchase more materials and clothes into her business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes R. is from the village of Libertad, Gingoog City. She is 47 years old. Lourdes is married. To make a living, Lourdes owns and operates a tailoring business, providing general  alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and threads. 

Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Lourdes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth D. is from the village of Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old. Janeth is single and has one infant child. 

To make a living, Janeth owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. Janeth is just starting this business.

In 2011, Janeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Janeth is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the first loan taken out by Janeth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is a married woman who lives in Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a timber sales business. Her husband Petronie, who is 49 years old, works as a vendor to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have eight children who are between 11 and 30 years old. Gaudiosa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gaudiosa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 18,500, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing PHP 21,000 to use as additional capital so that she can continue to save for the future expansion of her business. Gaudiosa is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase a chainsaw

loans.name: Naitiku Enole

texts.en:
Naitiku Enole K. is 28 years old, married and is the mother of four children. She has been farming her own piece of land for the past four years.

She learned about KADET LTD from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her second loan which she will use to buy maize seeds and fertilizer. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity.

Naitiku's dream is to provide a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ayman

texts.ar: ايمن في عمر 26 سنةاعزب يعمل في تنجيد وتصليح المفروشات المنزلية له في عمله 14 سنة يسعى الى تحسين العمل وتطويره يسعى الى دعم المصلحة وتكبير العمل له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه ما ينقصه هو المال الى زيادة رأس المال لتقوية المصلحة له خبرة كبيرة في مجال عمله يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء اقمشة واسفنج للمصلحة
texts.en: Ayman is 26 years old and single. He has been working for the past 14 years repairing and upholstering home furniture, serving his neighbors and other members of his community. He is very keen to further develop and expand his business but currently lacks sufficient capital. Accordingly, he would like to petition Al Majmoua for a loan to purchase supplies of fabric and foam for his work.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and foam for his work.

loans.name: Felecidad

texts.en:
Felecidad is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Felecidad is 40 years old.

Felecidad has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Felecidad requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

Felecidad has been in this business for nine years.  In the future, Felecidad would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a young and ambitious man. With his friend, he started up a small computer company, selling all sorts of electronics and devices that are attached to computers such as mouse, hard drives, printers, etc.

Rami, who is photographed in the picture here, took out a loan from FATEN to purchase more of the above-mentioned items and increase sales, Rami and his friend wish to have a big business in the future and lead the computer electronics industry.

loans.use: to improve their company's work by purchasing computer devices and electronics.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 38 años,es soltera, tiene casa propia, vive con ella sumadre,lacualcuenta con elserviciode agua y luz, ubicada en la prolongación Bolognesi 196, que pertenece al distrito de la Victoria y también a la provincia de Chiclayo.  En éste distrito la mayor parte de pobladores son comerciantes y choferes de transporte público.
La actividad que realiza Maribel desde hace 5 años es a la venta de periódicos, revista y golosinas en un pequeño puesto en la parte urbana del distrito de la Victoria.  Por encontrarse su negocio en un lugar muy concurrido, todos los productos que ofrece en especial los periódicos se venden rápido durante la mañana y con esos ingresos poder solventar los gastos de su casa.
El préstamo que solicitó a Edpyme Alternativa es de 2000 nuevos soles para implemntar un nuevo negocio en su casa(tienda de comestibles)  y finalmente seguir creciendo, con el fin de obtener mayores ingresos económicos.
Maribel es una hija muy responsable que con su esfuerzo y empeño a logrado salir adelante para tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su madre.
texts.en:
Maribel is 38 years old. She is single and has her own house where she lives with her mother. The house has running water and electricity and is located in the community of Bolognesi 196, which belongs to the district of Victoria, province of Chiclayo. Most of the people in this district are merchants and public transport drivers. 

Maribel's activity fot the last 5 years has been selling newspapers, magazines and candies in a small stall in the urban area of the district of La Victoria. Because it is a spot with a lot of people, all of the products she offers, especially the newspapers, sell out quickly in the morning. She is able to pay for her household expenses with this income.

The loan she asked Edpyme Alternativa for is for 2000 nuevos soles, to outfit a new business in her house (a food store) and to continue growing. Her goal is to obtain more income. Maribel is a very responsible daughter, who with her hard work and dedication has been able to get ahead and have a better quality of life with her mother.

loans.use: to outfit a new business in her house.

loans.name: Innocencia

texts.en:
Innocencia lives in the village of Barangay 17, Gingoog City. She is 48 years old, separated from spouse and has nine adult children. For the last five years, she has made a living by selling dried fish and earns about 10,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2010, Innocencia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid two previous loans from HSPFI and is applying for a new one, for 5,000 PHP, to buy more dried fish to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to improve her business.  

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: G-Tide Group

texts.en:
Mohamed, who is in his early 30s, is married and has two children. One is very young and the other one goes to school.  

Since 2005, he has had a business of selling fruits at a place called Tegeta. He works from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Mohamed’s sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans for household expenses and to increase his stock of fruits and has paid back all his loans successfully. He hopes for a loan to buy more fruits from Kariakoo markets for resale. His dream is to one day start selling rice in bulk.

Mohamed will share this loan with his loan group “G-tide” which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

One of the clients was looking at the chairperson who was busy filling the group loan agreement.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to resell.

loans.name: Muniratu

texts.en: For the past 15 years, Muniratu has been selling provisions such as milo, milk, biscuits, soap and other items at Abura. Married to a farmer, she takes care of one child. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the university education of her child.

loans.use: to buy more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC  AYLLU”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio Emilio tiene 49 años de edad, el socio es conviviente, El socio tiene 2 hijos de 12, 10 años de edad; el socio se dedica a la construcción en construcción ven todo lo referente a la fabricación de casas y edificios; ellos elaboran la base de cemento y otros materiales para la construcción de casas, ven los materiales a poner y la resistencia de los mismos; el socio trabaja en diversas obras, el socio en esta ocasión requiere el crédito para poder apoyar a su conyugue con la compra de verduras al por mayor, ya que la pareja del socio tiene un stand en el mercado y vende verduras como zanahoria, cebolla, pepinos, lechugas, tomate, habas, arvejas; la pareja del socio comprara al por mayor verduras y pagara a sus proveedores. El socio solicita el préstamo para apoyar a su conyugue a implementar su stand en el mercado de ventas de verduras que ella comprara.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Sumac Ayllu” community bank. The bank is located in the Huanchac district in the Cusco province and the Cusco department.

The member, Emilio, is 49 years old and is in a common-law marriage. He has two children aged 10 and 12 years old. He makes his living working in construction and a variety of projects. On this occasion the member needs a loan to be able to support his spouse with the purchase of wholesale vegetables as his spouse has a stand in the market and sells vegetables such as carrots, onions, peppers, lettuce, tomato, peas, etc. She will by wholesale vegetable and will pay the suppliers. The member is requesting a loan to be able to support his spouse in implementing her stand in the vegetable market.

The member appreciates the support you will give him and he is committed to paying his loan back in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of vegetables for his wife's stand

loans.name: Felizardo

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia de Cabo Delgado a Norte de Moçambique, tem 29 anos de idade vive maritalmente, fez a 10ª classe não continuou devido a sua ida a tropa, é pai de 3 filhos de 02 aos 07 anos dois vão a Escola Vive na casa própria com sua familia e não responsabiliza se por ninguem.

E incorporado na vida militar durante 3 anos e passa a fazer parte dos Agentes da Guarda Fronteira concretamente no Distrito de Namaacha onde fixa sua residência. É funcionario permanente ha mais de 5 anos, trabalha das 7.00h as 15.00h na area de Logistica e Finanças auferindo mensalmente 5.649.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da sua obra. Mas também conta com ajuda da sua esposa que é funcionária no Hotel Libombos no mesmo Distrito e consegue por vezes poupar 1.000.00mt na sua conta bancaria.

Este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar Material de Construção(cimento, blocos ,areia e mais ) para dar continuidade da sua obra  . Ja trabalhou com o BIM e conhece a Hluvuku atraves da sua esposa que também é cliente da instituição, pretende pagar cem nehum problema para aceder a outros créditos.
texts.en:
He was born in the Cabo Delgado province in the north of Mozambique.  He is 29-years-old, married, and completed his 10th year of schooling and didn’t continue because he joined the military.  He is the father to three children ranging from two to seven-years-old.  Two are in school.  He lives in his own home with his family and is not responsible for anyone else.  

He has been a part of the military for three years and has become a part of the Border Guard Agents, specifically in the Namaacha district where he lives.  He has been a permanent employee for more than five years and works from 7AM to 3Pm in the Logistics and Finances area earning 5,649 meticais (Mozambique currency) monthly which he uses for household and construction expenses.  He also has the help of his wife who is an employee in the Libombos Hotel in the same district and who can sometimes save 1,000 meticais in their bank account.

This is his first loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 10,000 meticais which he intends to use to buy construction materials (cement, blocks, sand, and more) to continue with his project.  He has already worked with the World Bank and he heard about Hluvuki through his wife who is also a customer of the institution and plans to make his payments without any problems in order to have access to other loans.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, blocks, sand, and more).

loans.name: Mery Luz

texts.es:
La Sra. Mery es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 8 años de edad la cual asiste al colegio, la Sra. Mery trabajaba en la ferretería de su hermana y tenía que dejar a su pequeña hija sola, hasta q un día decidió abrir su propio negocio para estar más tiempo al cuidado de su hija, por ello apertura su propia tienda de abarrotes y golosinas, ya en este negocio lleva 9 meses. Su principal desafío para Mery es poder mantener a su pequeña hija sin la ayuda de nadie; sus sueños de Mery es terminar de construir su casa y agrandar su negocio.
El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abarrotes (leche, azúcar, arroz, aceite, fideos) para así poder aumentar sus ventas. La Sra. Mery está muy agradecida por el servicio prestado, ya que se le pudo dar el apoyo para su propio negocio y por ayudarle a estar más cerca de su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Mery is a single mother; she has an 8-year-old daughter going to school.  Mery used to work in her sister’s hardware store and had to leave her little girl alone until she was able to open her own business to be able to spend more time taking care of her daughter.  Finally one day she decided to open her own business and stay closer to her daughter.  She opened her own grocery and snack store and has been in business nine months.  Mery’s main challenge is supporting her little daughter without any help from anybody. Mery’s dream is to finish building her house and to enlarge the store.

She will use the loan to buy groceries (milk, sugar, rice, oil, noodles) to increase sales.  Mery is very grateful for the services tendered because she was able to get support for a business of her own and for helping her be able to stay closer to her little girl.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Madilo

texts.en:
Madilo is a married man with two children; one attends school while the other one is still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, he has operated a carpentry business, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge in the lack of availability of materials for the carpentry business. He dreams of expanding and purchasing more equipment in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase raw materials for his carpentry business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete the payment of a vehicle he uses to transport his animals.

loans.name: Mberi Group

texts.en:
Jonas is 65 years old and lives in Masvingo. He is married and has five children aged 26, 31 and 33. None of his children attends school. 

Jonas sells clothes and drinks. He has been doing this business for eight years. He says the main challenge he faces is lack of sufficient working capital. Jonas has requested a loan of $400 to buy clothing and drinks for sale. He will use says the extra income generated to expand his business and pay his bills. 

In the future, Jonas plans to build a big business that will employ more people.

loans.use: To buy clothing and drinks for sale.

loans.name: 5 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El comité 5 de Mayo se formó gracias al deseo de mejora y superación del nivel de vida de sus integrantes ya que son personas de muy escasos recursos. Actualmente está integrado por 19 mujeres que trabajan incansablemente para darle a sus familias una vida digna y decorosa.
Una de las miembros es la señora Catalina, ella se define como una mujer trabajadora y muy sacrificada, comenta que se dedica a la venta de ropas usadas, gracias a esto ella logra sacar adelante a sus familiares que de ella dependen. Desea poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y de esa forma poder tener el sustento de su familia de forma segura.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, como ser remeras, camisas, pantalones para la posterior venta. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da,pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The communal bank "5 de Mayo" was formed because the members had a desire to improve and raise their standard of living, since they are people with very limited resources.  Currently this group is made up of 19 women who work tirelessly to provide their families with a dignified and decent life.  

One of the members of the group is Catalina.  She is described as a selfless and hardworking woman.  She tells us that she has a business selling used clothing, and thanks to this business she has been able to provide for the family members who are dependent upon her.  She wants to continue to grow her business, so that in this way she will be able to have a reliable way to support her family.

She requests a loan to purchase garments, such as T-shirts, shirts, and pants, to later sell.  She thanks the Fundación for the opportunity that they are giving her, as this loan will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy secondhand T-shirts, shirts, and pants to sell

loans.name: Jeanne D`arc

texts.en:
Jeanne is 34 years old and is married with three children. Her business is well organized and she is well known in this business of selling second hand clothing. Her business hours are from 6 am until 6 pm every day except on Sunday and she currently employs one person to help her. 

Jeanne has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying more second hand clothing for sale. With any profits, she will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le nom Bokk Jom est choisi pour illustrer leur  solidarité et leur amour pour le travail, le groupe est créé depuis le 4 décembre 2007,il est composé de sept femmes qui sont amies et voisines de longue date.Les femmes ont comme activité principale le commerce.

La responsable madame Yacine est âgée de 49 ans, elle est mariée mère de deux enfants et a en charge ses quatre neveux; elle mène une activité de transformation d'huile palmiste avec l'appui d'une société de la place depuis un an mais elle a toujours vendu du couscous et a une bonne expérience. Elle est debout à l'extrême droit habillée en blanc et a levé la main droite.

Elle se ravitaille sur place et vend au marché central de la ville.

Son prêt lui permettra d'augmenter la quantité à produire pour le couscous et les palmistes afin de gagner plus de revenus.
Elle souhaite aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et soutenir ses enfants dans leurs divers besoins et aussi leur acheter un terrain.
texts.en:
The name 'Bokk Jom' was chosen to illustrate this group's solidarity and their love for work.  The group was created on December 4th, 2007.  It has seven [female] members who are longstanding friends and neighbors.  The women's main business activity is commerce.

The leader of this group is 49-year-old Yacine.  She is married and has two children.  She is also responsible for her four nieces and nephews.  She has been running a business transforming palm oil with the support of a local company for one year.  She has also always sold couscous and has good experience in this line of work.  Yacine is the lady who is standing on the far right of this photo dressed in white and raising her right hand.

Yacine obtains fresh supplies close by and makes her sales in the central town market.

This loan will allow Yacine to increase the quantity of couscous that she produces and the amount of palm kernels she transforms so that she can earn more income.  Yacine hopes to help her husband with their daily expenses and to support their children with their various needs.  She would also like to buy them a plot of land.

loans.use: to transform food products to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 42 years of age, married, and has three children. Two of her children are still studying and the youngest is still an infant. Thelma works hard to support her family. 

She is engaged in a retail store business that she has been operating since 1998. She would like to maintain and to buy stock merchandise so that she can minimize her fare expenses in going to and from the market, but she doesn't have enough funds. 

In this regard, she is asking for financial assistance in the amount of PHP15,000. With this requested loan amount she will be able to offer all her customers' demands. She believes that her effort and additional capital could really help her in realizing the goal she wants.

loans.use: to purchase stock merchandise for her retail store business.

loans.name: Alecia

texts.en:
Alecia is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Alecia has a pigpen that sells mature and grown pigs. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy feed for the pigs.

Alecia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Alecia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Sultonkul

texts.ru: Султонкул женат и любящий отец троих детей. Он занимается предпринимательством, то есть продажей сладостей более 12 лет. Ему в данном бизнесе помогает супруга, которая очень хорошо знает технологию приготовления всех видов сладостей. У него большая семья, чтобы прокормить большую семью одним бизнесом не возможно и поэтому он дополнительно работает жестянщиком. Данное ремесло он унаследовал от отца. Султонкул запрашивает займ для расширения бизнеса и заранее благодарит вас за поддержку и помощь.
texts.en: Sultonkul is married and a loving father of three children. He has been selling sweets and cakes for the last 12 years at the local market. His spouse helps him and she is very knowledgeable in the techniques of making sweets of different varieties. Since they have such a large family the sweets business is not enough and Sultonkul supplements the family's income using his metal working business. He has learned the metal working trade from his father. Sultonkul is requesting this loan to expand his business and would like to thank in advance for your help and support.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en: Sambo, 34, is married and resides with her husband in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples.  She sells traditional baskets, and her husband is a construction worker. Sambo is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase more baskets to resell. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more baskets to resell

loans.name: Sivaimamao

texts.en:
Sivaimamao is 22 years of age and married.

Sivaimamao owns & operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  She has 1 year of experience in this business.    Sivaimamao needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Sivaimamao joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Sivaimamao's 1st loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  "

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en: Nidal is a 31-year-old young man, he is married with no children yet, and is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Nidal wants to finish his house by installing tiles, painting, installing lights...etc, so he can live in better house conditions with the family. Nidal needs to take a loan from FATEN to help him supplement the amount he has. Taking this loan will enable Nidal to complete his house and provide to his family better and more comfortable housing conditions. Nidal is shown in the picture.

loans.use: To pay the expenses for finishing his house

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a 54-year-old businessman s married to Rose. He has been running a restaurant for the past 11 years with the monthly income of 15,000 KES which he uses to support his children.

He is applying for his fifth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Amos will use the loan to buy more stock of sugar and rice for his restaurant with the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

He hopes to open another restaurant which will increase his income and improve the living standards of his family.
