Eugenie is 43 years old and married with three children. The first child is 20 years old, the next is 15 and the last is 11 years old. Eugenie takes care of one dependent who is 10 years. Eugenie owns a small business selling various styles of clothes. Eugenie has enough experience in this field because this is her fifth year of experience. The hours of her shop are from 8 in the morning to 7 in the evening every day except one day in the week. Eugenie is group leader of her group, which is called TWUZUZANYE in the local language. This group contains 11 members with different businesses.

Now, Eugenie and her group are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their business through purchasing more products for their business. With this loan, Eugenie and her group will be able to satisfy their customers, which will be one of the ways of earning more profits.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Donathile

texts.en:
Donathile is 40 years old and is married with six children, two of whom are twins. Her children range from 4 to 14 years old and four of them are in school. Her husband is a farmer and, together, they afford health insurance for the whole family.

Donathile sells cassava in the local market and has been doing this business for five years. With the loan, she hopes to expand her business to include other produce in her store. She eventually hopes to work in larger markets and become self-sustaining.

loans.use: To expand her business to include other produce in her store

loans.name: Yukuyoo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Yukuyoo las integrantes D. este grupo decidieron ponerle así, por que eso significa el nombre D. L. comunidad en donD. viven, en mixteco ( Yukuyoo-San L.).
Doña Flora M. C. es L. representante D. este grupo, elL. esta casada tiene 3 hijos Laydis D. 17 años que estudia el cebeta, Alberto D. 13 quien esta  estudiando el segundo año D. secundaria y Aníbal D. 8 años que esta cursando el 4° año D. primaria, elL. se dedica a L. venta D. dulces en L. cooperativa D. L. escueL. donD. estudia uno D. sus hijos, el crédito que recibirá lo va a invertir en L. compra D. mas dulces, chicharrones, refrescos y demás antojitos para seguir vendiendo.
 
ElL. decidió dedicarse a esta actividad por que le ofrecieron trabajar en L. cooperativa D. L. secundaria donD. estudia su hijo, y también por que quería buscar L. manera D.  mejorar su calidad D. vida y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos D. L. casa  y L. educación D. sus hijos.
 
Doña Flora esta muy satisfecha, ya que dice que le va muy bien con las ventas D. este negocio ,puesto que ahora con los estudiantes estuvieron D. vacaciones, elL. estuvo realizando esta actividad en su casa y obtuvo muy buenos resultados pero ahora que ya regresaron a clases, va a volver a vender en L. escueL., ya que ahí también obtiene muy buenos ingresos.  
 
Me platica que en ninguna ocasión fallará con los pagos D. su crédito, ni elL. ni sus compañeras del grupo ya que dice son personas muy responsables y sobre todo puntuales, ya que son mujeres muy trabajadoras que tienen ganas D. superarse y mejorar su forma D. vida puesto que ya tienen tiempo D. conocerse y dice que son personas muy confiables, ya que todas pertenecen a L. misma comunidad.
 
Quiere darle las gracias a kiva y a sus donadores por el apoyo y L. confianza que le han brindado a elL. y a las demás integrantes del grupo, ya que gracias a eso han podido continuar invirtiendo en su negocio y ayudar a mejorar L. vida D. sus familias.
 
Las metas que tiene doña Flora y dice esta segura va a lograr con el apoyo D. L. empresa, es el D. construir un cuarto para poner se negocio D. venta D. dulces y así obtener mejores ingresos también quiere seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios para que tengan una muy buena carrera profesional.
 
El nombre y las actividades que realizan las integrantes del grupo Yukuyoo son las siguientes:
Flora M. C.-venta D. dulces
Analidia C. D. L. C.-borda servilletas
Gregoria N. B.-venta D. dulces
Inocencia B. M.- borda servilletas
María H. M.- borda servilletas
RafaeL. H. R.- borda servilletas
Serafina M. S.-venta D. pan
Maximina M. B.- borda servilletas
Antelma B. B.-venta D. antojitos
Paulina R. B.- borda servilletas
Florencia G. B.- borda servilletas
Andra L. M.-venta D. antojitos
texts.en:
The members of this group decided to call themselves “Yukuyoo” because it is the Mixtec name for the community in which they live (Yukuyoo-San L.). Doña Flora M. C. is the group representative. She is married and has three children: Laydis is 17 years old and studying in El Cebeta, Alberto is 13 years old and in his second year of high school, and Anibal is 8 years old and in the fourth graD.. Doña Flora makes a living selling candy at a cooperative located near the school where one of her children attends. The loan she will receive will be used to buy more candy, pork rinds, soft drinks, and other snacks to sell.

She decided to pursue this business because it gave her the opportunity to work at the cooperative near her son’s high school. In addition, she likes finding ways to improve her quality of life and helping her husband with the household expenses and their children’s education.

Doña Flora is very pleased because the sales at her business have been doing well. While her students were on vacation, she continued to sell from home and obtained very good results. Now that classes have started again and children will be returning to school, she expects to generate a very good income.

Doña Flora says she has never failed to make a payment on her loan and neither have her fellow group members. She says they are responsible people and all of them are prompt. All of these women work very hard because they want to succeed and improve their way of life. Since everyone in her group is from the same community, Flora says they are all trustworthy because they have spent a great deal of time getting to know another.

She wants to thank Kiva and its lenders for the support and confidence they have demonstrated to her and the other members of her group. They appreciate the opportunity to continue investing in their businesses so that they can improve the lives of their families.

Now that she has secured financial support for her business, Doña Flora says her goals are to build a room for her business where she can sell candy and to improve her income. She also wants to support her children with their studies so that they can become successful career professionals.

The members of the Yukuyoo Group and their business activities are listed below: Flora M. C. – sells candy Analidia C. D. L. C. – makes embroidered napkins Gregoria N. B. – sells candy Inocencia B. M. – makes embroidered napkins María H. M. – makes embroidered napkins RafaeL. H. R. – makes embroidered napkins Serafina M. S. – sells bread Maximina M. B. – makes embroidered napkins Antelma B. B. – sells snacks Paulina R. B. – makes embroidered napkins Florencia G. B. – makes embroidered napkins Andra L. M. – sells snacks

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy, pork rinds, soft drinks, and snacks to sell

loans.name: Mercy Ekua

texts.en: Mercy Ekua N. is married and has two children. She has received junior high school education. Mercy Ekua sells raw maize and rice in both small and large quantities in Elmina. Her husband is a trader. Mercy Ekua uses her income to assist her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills. Mercy Ekua will use this loan to purchase more of her goods for sale. Mercy Ekua plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to build a storehouse for her goods.

loans.use: To purchase more of her goods for sale

loans.name: The Lillies Group

texts.es:
La señora Soraida López V. vive en el Barrio San Francisco de Copainala Estado de Chiapas México, es casada con el señor Floricel Rojas Pérez, en cual procrearon tres hijos varones, el primero es Braulio de catorce años en tercero de secundaria, Rubicel de doce en primero de secundaria y el ultimo es marco Jareth de cinco años.

   Ella se dedica a su hogar y solicitó el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra y venta de catálogos de zapatos, para que con ello apoye a su esposo en los ingresos de su hogar y los gastos de sus hijos que estudian en esto lleva practicando ocho años y cuatro meses donde cometa que le va muy bien.

   Lo que lo motivo a realizar esta actividad fue su familia ya que su esposo hubo un tiempo que se quedo sin trabajo y decidió a  ella mientras lo encontraba y ahora mejor se dedica a la elaboración de block el que también le da buen resultado.

   Con las ganancia que obtiene lo invierte comprando mas mercancía y así obtenga mejores ingresos, para que con ello también pague el préstamo que fundación  realidad le otorgo.

   Su sueño es que su block era crezca día adía y con ello sacar adelante a su familia que es lo más importante para ella verlos con un buen futuro y mejor educación.

   Formo parte del grupo ya que la invitaron las demás integrantes a unirse a ellas y participar en el préstamo, el grupo se llama las azucenas la razón del nombre es porque en el patio tiene flores con ese nombre.
   
Las integrantes del grupo son cinco y cada una con diferente actividad:

   Soraida López Velazco: compra y venta de catálogos de zapatos de  pardo, Andrea, terra.

   María Estela López M.: invierte el préstamo en la compra y venta de cosméticos  como son: perfumes, labiales, desodorantes entre otros.
   Guadalupe López A.: invierte el préstamo en la compra de mercancías para surtir su tienda de abarrotes como son: azúcar, aceite, frijol, harina entre otros.
  María del Carmen V. García: invierte el préstamo en la compra de pollos para venderlos aliñados (destazados).
  Joayda Sánchez Sánchez: invierte el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tamales como son: carne,  aceite, pasas, masa, entre otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Soraida L. V. lives in the San Francisco de Copainala district in the state of Chiapas in Mexico. She is married to Mr. Floricel Rojas Perez and together they had three boys. The eldest is Braulio, 14 years old and in grade 9, then it's Rubicel, 12 years old and in grade 7, and the youngest is Marco Jareth, 5 years old. She is a homemaker but she requested a loan to supplement her business, buying and selling shoe catalogues. She will be able to contribute with her husband to the household income and to cover her sons' school expenses. She has been running this business for the past 8 years and 4 months. She mentioned that she has been very successful. Her motivation behind her business is her family. Her husband was out of work for some time and so she decided to work at her business while he found a job. Today he makes cement blocks as a business and he has also see great success. Her dream is to have her business grow more day after day and to provide for her family. It is the most important thing for her to see her children with a good future and a good education. She became a member of the group when she was invited by the other members to join them and participate in the loan program. The group name is "The Lilies" and it was chosen because there are lilies in the courtyard where they meet. There are five members in this group and each one has a different business: Soraida L. Velazco: buys and sells shoe catalogues of Pardo, Andrea, and Terra brand names. Maria Estela L. Mesa: she will invest her loan in the resale of cosmetics, such as perfumes, lipsticks, deodorants etc. Guadalupe L. A.: she will invest her loan in the purchase of merchandise to stock her grocery store with items such as: sugar, cooking oil, beans, flour, etc. Maria del Carmen V. G.: she will invest her loan in the purchase of chicken to sell as meat (butchered). Joayda S. S.: she will invest her loan in the purchase of ingredients to make tamales: meat, cooking oil, raisins, corn dough, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoe catalogues of Terra and Andrea brand names.

loans.name: Conjesta

texts.en:
Conjesta is 47 years old. She is married and has been blessed with 5 school-aged children. She has been practicing mixed farming for ten years in Kitale town, in western Kenya. Her mixed farm produces milk and beans, which she sells locally. She depends on the income from her farming activities to meet her family’s basic needs. Her major challenges in farming have been the high cost of dairy feeds and low market prices for her milk.

Conjesta has requested a loan of 36,400 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of the cow’s milk will help her to meet her family’s basic needs. She hopes to be able to increase her milk production and adopt zero grazing practices in the future.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 27 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Mario de 30 años que es transportista y de sus 2 hijos que aún estudian en el colegio. Desde hace 5 años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de ropa, lencería y productos de belleza  por pedido, y esta muy satisfecha pues obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Le gusta mucho su labor pues es tranquila y la desempeña sin descuidar las labores de su hogar. La mayoría de sus clientes son las madres de familia del colegio de sus hijos, y como les tiene confianza les ofrece las prendas y los productos de belleza  al crédito, para luego cobrarles en partes con un interés. Lo que le disgusta de su labor es el atraso de algunos clientes en los pagos, lo que le genera una demora en el movimiento de su capital de trabajo. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un puesto de venta de ropa en un centro comercial de su zona, de esta manera espera mejorar aún más sus ganancias. Es el  primer  crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Nelly tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en ropa, que necesita para cumplir con un pedido que tiene pendiente y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Nelly, age 27, lives in her own home alongside her husband Mario (age 30 and a driver) and their two children who are high school students. For the past five years, this enterprising woman has been selling clothing, lingerie, and beauty products upon request. She is very pleased with the regular income that she earns because it enables her to help her husband with the household expenses. Nelly enjoys her work because it is peaceful and does not interfere with her household chores. Most of her customers are mothers who have children in the same school where her own children attend. Nelly trusts her customers since she offers them clothing and beauty products on credit and then later collects installments with interest. What she dislikes about her work is when some of her customers fall behind in their payments because it delays the use of her operating capital. Being an enterprising woman, she plans to establish a clothing stand at the local shopping center in hopes of improving her earnings.

This is her first loan with MFP. Nelly promises to complete her payments on time because she does not want to look bad in the eyes of those who made this loan possible so that she can continue working and making progress. She plans to invest the loan she requested in the purchase of clothing she needs to complete a pending order and get ahead.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to fulfill a pending order

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Flores de Vilquechico”  ubicado en el distrito de Vilquechico, provincia Huancané y departamento de Puno, tiene 41 años de edad, de estado civil casada y con 03 hijos, la señora tienes estudios de educación secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 01 año, el primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de animales caseros.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para comprar chanchos y ovejas para su negocio. 
	
Su sueño es tener más capital para mejorar su negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Virginia is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Flores de Vilquechico” (The Flowers of Vilquechico), which is located in the District of Vilquechico, Huancané Province, Department of Puno. She is 41 years old, married, and has three children. Virginia completed her high school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for the past year. Her first loan was in the amount of 500 PEN, which increased her business capital for selling domesticated animals.

Now she is requesting a new loan of 600 PEN so that she can buy pigs and sheep for her business. Virginia dreams of having more capital to improve her business. What she likes most about of her Communal Bank are the promptness and the responsibility.

loans.use: Purchase pigs & sheep

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN SONCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Isabel; ella tiene 35 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 1 hijo;la socia se dedica a dar clases particulares a niños que necesitan  la socia es docente y por el momento dicta clases particulares, y así puede tener más tiempo para su familia hasta que pueda presentar sus papeles algún colegio de Cusco.

La  socia solicita el préstamo para la educación y alimentación de su hijo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: This member belongs to the community bank called “HATUN SONCCO”.  This group is located in the Cusco district, near the province and department of Cusco. Mrs. Isabel is 35 years old, married and has 1 child. She works giving private lessons to children in need. She is a teacher who currently teaches private classes; thus she has more time for her family until she can present her papers to a school in Cusco. She is requesting a loan for educating and feeding her child. She thanks those who are making this dream possible and promises to comply with the payment of her dues on time.

loans.use: This member is requesting a loan for feeding and educating her child.

loans.name: Trabajando Unidas Group

texts.es:
TRABAJANDO UNIDAS

Lucia  tiene 49 años de edad pertenece ala Alcancía comunal                              “TRABAJANDO UNIDAS” que ya tiene 2 años de estar formada la señora lucia  tiene el cargo de presidenta hace 7 meces y entre los 7 integrantes q conforman este grupo actualmente decidieron ponerle el nombre de Trabajando Unidas a su Alcancía Comunal  por que en el grupo tiene que haber mucha unión y mucho trabajo.la alcancía comunal ya tiene 2 años trabajando con Edaprospo-Prosperidad Lucia pertenecía a otro grupo de Alcancía Comunal el cual lo dejo y por medio de una amiga se unió al grupo Trabajando unidas Lucia apararece en al lado izquierdo de la foto con un polo de color amarillo claro y un chaleco de color crema y su pantalon de color lila claro.
Lucia tiene 4 hijos los cuales 2 son dependientes y 2 son independientes Lucia comenzó a  preparar y vender comidas, mermeladas y tanbien hacia tejidos de lana  “CHOMPAS” con la finalidad de poder mantener a sus 2 hijos que aun viven con ella y tanbien la de levantar su casa y equiparla con muebles. 
La señora quisiera un capital para poder incrementar su cantidad de producción de  “Comida, Mermeladas y Chompas”
texts.en:
WORKING TOGETHER

Lucia, 49, is a member of the “TRABAJANDO UNIDAS” (Working Together) communal bank which has been in existence for two years.  Lucia has been President for the last 7 months.  The seven members currently in the group chose the bank name because the group must have unity and work. The communal bank has been collaborating with Edaprospo-Prosperidad for two years.

Lucia used to belong to a different communal bank but she dropped out of it and through a friend joined Trabajando Unidas.  Lucia is at the far left of the photo wearing a light yellow polo shirt and cream colored vest; her pants are light lilac.

Lucia has 4 children; two are independent and two still depend on her.  Lucia started making food and marmalade to sell and she knitted woolens sweaters in order to support the two children that still live with her as well as to build and furnish her house.

She’d like to have capital to increase her production of food, marmalade and sweaters.

loans.use: To increase sweater and food production.

loans.name: Yaser

texts.en:
Yaser is a 36-year-old father of three daughters and two sons. He has a grocery store in the city and also works in the sheep trade. Yaser was a construction worker but changed his job a year and a half ago as he had an accident which prevented him from working in construction. He took a loan from FATEN to increase the variety he sells in the grocery store, which will increase the number of clients and profits. 

Yaser appears in the picture above in his store.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of goods to sell in his store

loans.name: Donatien

texts.en:
Donatien is 45 years old. He is married with four children between the ages of eight and twenty. He sells beer, and employs eight other people to help him. He has been in the business for six years and the business is open from 7am to 6pm every day except on Saturdays. 

Donatien will use this loan to increase his business. He plans to reinvest any profit he makes back into the business.

loans.use: To increase his business.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 42 years old, married,  and has four children, all of whom attend school. Alphonsine owns a restaurant, where she works with her husband.  She has been in this business for 21 years. Alphonsine is requesting a loan in order to buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant. She plans to pay her children’s school fees with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Phom's Group

texts.en:
Eight people form this village loan. They are located in Champuh K'aek village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Phom S. is the village bank president selected by the other members. She earns her living by selling eggs and vegetables in the local markets.  She is asking for a loan to buy more eggs and vegetables to expand her business. 

Mrs. Phom S. was born in 1955, and is widow with two children: one is a laborer, and the other works with Mrs. S. in the egg and vegetable selling business.

loans.use: To buy more eggs and vegetables to expand her business.

loans.name: Recy

texts.en:
Recy E. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 43 years old. Recy is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Recy owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing pedicure and manicure services to local community members. Recy has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Recy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Recy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Recy is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service like nail polish, nail cutters and sharpeners. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Recy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service like nail polish, nail cutters and sharpeners

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 35-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and one young child. She has 14 years of experience working as a farmer. She has been running her own farm since 2000. She uses plastic tents to grow her produce. These tents allow her to better monitor product quality as well as grow her products for more months during the year. 

She works independently in her business, and she distributes vegetables and fruits she harvests to local markets. She helps her husband who works as a construction worker to satisfy the family needs.

 Today, she is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase needed supplies for her work in addition to buying extra agricultural tents. She hopes that the loan will help her increase her profits by 15%. This will be her second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase needed supplies in addition to buying extra agricultural tents.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David F. is from the village of Carugmanan, Banisilan, Cotabato. He is 63 years old. David is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, David owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as powder detergents, clorox, and powder juices in the local community. David has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, David joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. David has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. David is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by David from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more land and good quality seed

loans.name: Sojidamo

texts.en:
N. Sojidamo is a hard-working woman who is married and has four children. Her husband and son help her in her grocery sales business. She lives near the market of Sakhovat. She purchases goods from wholesalers and sells them at a retail price. Before, she did not have the opportunity for a wide range of goods, but now she has a large assortment of goods. Sojidamo would like to get a loan of 5,000 Somoni to purchase a new selection of goods due to market demand and to increase the assortment of goods in her business. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
From Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh city, Ben Y. sells for daily revenue.  She can earn about 5 USD profit per day from her fish-selling business. All the fresh fish that she always takes to sell in and around her village is taken from her wholesale suppliers in bulk at a reasonable price, so she can sell them out to gain revenue every day.

Her husband is an unemployed person as he just resigned from his work. Ben Y. is the core person who has a strong commitment to contributing all the cash on hand, and she also has three single children who are still being educated in the public school and rely on her income also.

Ben Y. will use this loan to repair her house, on which the repairing process has not been completed. By using this money, she can finish the mending soon.

loans.use: to repair her old house.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.ar: محمد عمره 22 سنة يعمل في بيع وصناعة البلاط له في عمله 15 سنة اعزب يحب العائلة وهو مسؤول وتعتمد عائلته على دعمه لهم له تاريخ جيد في العمل فهو محب لعمله وقد طوره بشكل جيد يتميز عمله بالدقة والعمل الجيد لأنه يعمل بدقة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء مواد اولية للعمل حتى يتمكن من تجديد العمل وتوير لكي يتمكن من مواجهة المنافسة التي يتعرض لها في ظل الوضع المادي السيء فهو يسهى دائما الى الاعتماد على نفسه في العمل ويريد من خلال تحسين عمله الى تأسيس عائلة
texts.en: Mohamad is a 22-year-old bachelor who works to support his extended family. He enjoys 15 years of experience in manufacturing and selling ceramics, work which he has developed through his attention to detail and excellence. Mohamad wanted to apply for a loan from A. Majmoua to procure raw materials for his business so that he can gain more of an edge against his stiff competition. He always seeks to be self-reliant and to advance his career so that he can start a family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for his ceramics business.

loans.name: Buenas Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Doña Josefina es una señora casada, tiene 32 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 4 hijos los cuales estudian el nivel primario, se dedica a los oficios D. la casa y a la confeccion D. faldas, lo cual es una fuente D. ingreso económico para ella, lleva 10 años D. experiencia en este trabajo, inició por iniciativa propia y deseos D. superación, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien también se dedica a la confección D. tejidos y al comercio. 

Organiza un grupo con el propósito D. solicitar un préstamo que servirá para ampliación D. su capital D. trabajo, para la compra D. telas para la cofección D. faldas, las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a diversas actividades productivas económicamente como: confeccion D. faldas, confeccion D. blusas, atención a tienda en general, venta D. ropa típica, y a la crianza D. animales. En el futuro desean tener mejor capitalizacion y negocio con nuevos productos.
texts.en:
Doña Josefina, age 32, is a married woman who did not have the opportunity to study. She has four children who are in elementary school. Josefina devotes herself to her housework and to making skirts, which is her source of financial income. She has 10 years of experience performing this type of work. Josefina got started as a result of her own initiative and desire to succeed. She has the support of her husband, who also works as a weaver and a merchant.

Josefina organized a group for the purpose of requesting a loan to increase her operating capital for buying fabrics used in making skirts. The other members of the group engage in different business activities to earn income such as making skirts, making blouses, managing a general store, selling traditional clothing, and raising animals. In the future, they hope to increase their capital and generate new products through their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en: Alima buys and supplies bags of maize and charcoal at Abura. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a watchman. She is responsible for assisting her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of charcoal to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business toward building a store room for her goods.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia D. 50 años D. edad, habita con su esposo e hijo en su casa. Su esposo Mario D. 44 años D. edad y su hijo D. 14 años, le ayudan en su negocio que desD. hace años ha sido su principal fuente D. ingresos. Ella se dedica a la venta D. desayunos D. manera ambulante en las principales áreas D. la zona donD. habita. DesD. tempranas horas D. la mañana se levanta a preparar  los ricos e higiénicos desayunos que día a día ofrece a sus clientes, gracias a su carisma y amabilidad en su trabajo ha logrado ganarse la confianza D. muchas personas y cada día el nivel D. clientes aumenta. Debido a esto ha decidido aumentar la oferta D. sus platillos con el objetivo D. cubrir una mayor demanda y lograr aumentar sus ganancias. Esto la ha llevado a tomar la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar la materia prima necesaria como: pollo, carne, verduras, frijoles, maíz, arroz, huevos, aceite, etc. Que le permitan aumentar el número D. platillos que ofrece así como atraer el número D. clientes necesarios que compren sus ricos desayunos. Con esto espera obtener mejores ganancias que le permitan brindar una mejor calidad D. vida a su familia.
texts.en: Lucia is 50 years old and she lives with her husband and son at home. Her husband Mario is 44 years old and their son is 14 years old. They help her with the business, which for years has been their primary source of income. She sells lunch foods itinerantly through the main streets of the region where she lives. She starts her day in the early morning to prepare her delicious and healthy lunch foods that she sells to her clients day after day. Thanks to her charisma and her kindness she has managed to earn many clients and each day they increase in number. She has decided to increase the variety in her menu with the objective of covering a greater demand and to increase her earnings. This has led her to take the decision of requesting a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner). She will purchase necessary ingredients, such as: chicken, meat, vegetables, beans, corn, rice, eggs, cooking oil, etc. This will help her increase production and it will attract the volume of clients she needs to purchase her lunch foods. Through this she expects to improve her income and it will help her proviD. a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as chicken, meat, vegetables, beans, corn, rice, eggs, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Idrissa A.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from a primary school in Mile-Ninety-One, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of SLL 5,000,000; with the help of this loan, some of these teachers will invest in their businesses, others will pay school fees for their children, etc. At the end of each month, the school’s bursar is directly responsible for repaying SMT on their behalf. 

Idrissa is a teacher at the school and the leader of this group. The 35-year-old has been in the teaching profession for many years now. A native of a village called Kambrabia Yoni, Idrissa is married and has 3 children. Idrissa has requested a loan of SLL 1,200,000 in order to buy materials for building house - cement and iron-corrugated zinc - for the completion of a project that is underway.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a house

loans.name: Kriscia Maria

texts.es:
Kriscia, vive con su familia, su esposo y dos hijos,  ella se dedica a atender un comedor y pupuseria, este negocio comenzó por el apoyo de su esposo y de su madre, trabaja en un local alquilado y su horario de venta es de 7:00am a 6:00pm, a parte de este negocio, su esposo tiene una libreria y servicios de fotocopias y ventar de articulos de computacion.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería como: pollo, vegetales, carnes, chicharrón, quesillo y aceite, esta compra le ayudara tanto para la producción de alimentos en el comedor como también para la pupuseria.
Su aspiración es ser una mujer exitosa, incrementar la clientela, tener casa propia y junto a su familia tener una mejor condición económica.
texts.en:
Kriscia lives with her family, her husband and two children. She makes her living running a cafeteria and pupuseria (a location selling stuffed thick corn tortillas). She began this business with the help of her husband and her mother. She works from a rented location and her hours of operation are from 7:00am to 6:00pm.

She is requesting a loan to purchase goods such as chicken, vegetables, meat, chicharrón (pork rinds), fresh cheese and cooking oil. These purchases will help her a lot with food preparation at the cafeteria as well as the pupuseria. 

Her aspirations include being a successful woman, increasing her clientele, having her own house and having a better economic condition for her and her family.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as chicken, vegetables, meat, chicharrón (pork rinds), fresh cheese and cooing oil.

loans.name: Karyn

texts.en: Karyn is a hardworking 23-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with a one-year-old child. She has been running a general shop for the last four years to make a living. She wants in the next five years to have expanded her business premises so that she is able to achieve her dream of being a wholesaler. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy soap, sugar and bread. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for training her on good customer relations.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and bread to sell

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemí tiene 56 años, vive en su tierra natal con su esposo en su casa propia. Trabajo desD. su niñez en las tareas del campo, porque proviene D. una humilD. familia agricultora, ahora es su principal fuente D. ingreso que junto a su esposo desD. hace 32 años siguen cultivando los terrenos que ambos heredaron D. sus padres. Ahí siembra papa, maíz y cebolla principalmente, también realiza su trabajo en la ganadería, posee vacas y toros en su establo que cada día con la ayuda D. su esposo y sus hijos las cuidas.  Manifiesta que le agrada trabajar en la ganadería porque le otorga mejores ganancias que la agricultura misma, además siempre tiene disponible la leche que producen sus vacas y del que es vendido, Por tanto ha decidió incrementar su capital D. trabajo en la compra D. más ganado vacuno. Se emtero D. MFP por medio D. sus vecinos que la invitaron a formar parte D. un grupo solidario y que actualmente es un grupo muy unido, le agrada trabajar D. esta manera porque pueD. mejorar su capital D. trabajo. Es por esta razón que el dinero que solicita, estará destinado en la compra D. sacos D. abono para su cultivo D. cebolla y pasto.
texts.en:
Noemí, 56, lives with her husband in the same place where she was born in her own house.  She’s worked in the fields since childhood because she comes from a humble family of farmers.  Now, it’s her and her husband’s main source of income; they have been working the fields they both inherited from their parents for the last 32 years.  She grows potatoes, corn and onions, primarily, but also raises livestock; she has cows and bulls in her stable that she cares for daily with help from her husband and children.  She states that she enjoys working raising animals because it produces better profits than farming.  Besides, she always has milk available to sell that her cows produce.

For this reason she’s decided to increase working capital buying more cattle.  She found out about MFP through neighbors that invited her to form part of a communal bank and which today is a very united group.  It pleases her to work this way because she can improve her working capital.  The money she’s requesting is destined to purchase sacks of manure for her onion and pasture grass crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Yohana

texts.en:
Yohana, a 36-year-old lady who is married to Edy, a 38-year-old man, is the mother of four children: Beny, 10, in the fourth grade of Elementary School; Evy, 7, in the second grade of Elementary School; Lena, 3 and Feny, 1 year old. The family lives in a very simple house comprised of a zinc roof, ground floor and palm tree branches.

Eight years ago, with a small amount of capital from her husband, Yohana started a small kiosk business selling goods such as noodles, sugar, coffee, snacks, cigarettes, detergent, soap, etc. She is grateful that the income generated from this business can assist her husband in meeting their daily needs.

Yohana is planning to improve her business by adding more products, and so is requesting a loan of IDR 5,000,000 to purchase items such as rice, kerosene, sugar, coffee, wheat flour, eggs, cigarettes, etc. She has repaid all previous loans from TLM’s Group Lending Program, and really hopes that TLM will continue to support her efforts to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her business such as rice, kerosene, sugar, coffee, wheat flour, eggs, cigarettes, etc.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Komi est un homme de 36 ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse. Il n’a pas d’enfant.
Komi travaille comme électronicien depuis 2003. Il répare les télévisions dans son atelier situé dans un quartier de la place. Il achète les pièces de réparation au port autonome de Lomé. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est que les pièces qu’il achète sont parfois vétustes.
Komi a requis son premier cycle de prêt à  WAGES afin d’acheter des télévisions d’occasion. Dans les prochaines années, Komi voudrait agrandir son commerce.
texts.en: Komi is 36 years old and married to a saleswoman. The couple have no children. Komi has been working as an electrician since 2003. He fixes televisions in a local workshop and buys spare parts from the Autonomous Port of Lomé. His main problem is that the parts he buys are occasionally obsolete, so Komi is requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy some second-hand televisions. In the next few years, he would like to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy second-hand televisions.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Doña Modesta tiene 58 años es viuda aun tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella Maite que tiene 17 años que ya no siguió estudiando y Jesús de 18 años que tampoco ya no estudia solo terminaron la secundaria.
La señora Modesta se dedica a la crianza de borregos para después venderlos cuando ya están grandes y fuertes, ella tiene por el momento 15 borregos en dicha actividad lleva ya 25 años de experiencia, nos comenta que por el momento no presenta ninguna dificultar, pero si llega el momento en que sus borregas necesitan de cuidado como desparasitarlos cada dos meses o tres también aplicarles vitaminas cada dos meses. Para que no se enfermen y cuando les da tos también los lleva al veterinario para que le den el medicamento correspondiente, ella los saca a pastar en las tardes si no puede ella quien le ayuda son sus hijos Maite y Jesús.
Esta vez ella ha solicitado el crédito para comprarles alimento y vitaminas ya que doña Modesta cree que si sus borregas están bien crecidas y fuertes  sus ganancias serán aun mejor.
Las esperanzas que tiene doña Modesta es seguir prosperando con sus borregas que sigan reproduciéndose para vender dos o tres borregos y con las ganancias quiere arreglarles su corral, para que enfermen le preocupa porque ya llegaron los fríos y es posible que enfermen
"Yo le agradezco a FRAC y KIVA por la ayuda que me han brindado yo llevo prestando dinero a la institución desde hace 20 años es por eso que me ha ido también con mis animalitos.
texts.en:
Modesta, age 58, is a widow, and she still has two children who are dependent upon her.  Maite, age 17, no longer goes to school.  Jesús, age 18, no longer goes to school either.  They only finished middle school.

Modesta raises sheep to later sell when they are big and strong.  She now has 15 lambs that she is raising.  She has 25 years of experience.  She tells us that for the time being there is no problem.  However, the time comes that her lambs need care like deworming every two or three months.  She also gives them vitamins every two months so that they do not get sick.  When they cough she also takes them to the veterinarian to get the appropriate medicine.  She takes them to graze in the afternoons.  If she is not able do that, her sons, Maite and Jesús, help her.

This time she is requesting the loan to buy them feed and vitamins.  Modesta believes that if her sheep have grown well and strong her income will be even better.

Modesta’s hopes are to continue thriving with her sheep, and that they continue reproducing in order to sell two or three sheep.  With the earnings she wants to fix up a corral for them.  When they get sick she worries because it is already cold, and they could possibly get sick.

"I am grateful to FRAC and Kiva for the help they have given me.  I have been borrowing money from the institución for 20 years.  That is the reason I have fared well with my little animals."

loans.use: to buy feed for the sheep.

loans.name: Mary Leonor

texts.es:
Mary de 44 años, vive en una zona suburbana llamada “Isla trinitaria”, llamada así porque está ubicada sobre una Isla.

Hace 2 años se compró un vehículo, ya que ella brinda servicios de taxi. Ella alquila su vehículo a choferes de confianza. ya que ella no sabe manejar.

Ella solicita este préstamo para poder invertir en su vehículo accesorios y el dinero restante para  hacer chequeos médicos ya que se siente enferma desde hace mucho tiempo. 

El sueño de ella es terminar su vivienda y mejorar cada día de su vida.
texts.en: Mary, 44, lives in a suburban zone called “Isla Trinitaria,” so called because it’s located on an island.  She bought a vehicle two years ago since she provides taxi services.  She leases her vehicle to trustworthy drivers since she does not know how to drive.  She’s requesting this loan to buy accessories for her vehicle.  Any money left over will be used for some medical check-ups because she’s been feeling unwell for some time now.  Her dream is to finish building her house and improve her life every day.

loans.use: to buy car accessories.

loans.name: Ally

texts.en:
Ally is a married man who has six children, all of whom are currently enrolled in school. His wife works in the food business. Ally has operated a business selling charcoal for three years; he sells from home and door-to-door. His primary customers are households and institutions. He owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Ally's other source of income includes felling trees. He describes his greatest business challenges to be transportation and accessibility during the rainy seasons. His highest monthly expense is food. 

Ally will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy charcoal and order wood planks. Ally aspires to open a motorcycle repair shop in the future. He joined Yehu because they believe in small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and order wood planks

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy works hard to earn a living. He is 41 years old, married and has two children.

Judy has managed his corn field business for almost 20 years. He said that the main source of income for his family comes primarily from his farming business. He would like to support his family's needs (most especially for his two students) but due to the high cost of commodities, he suffered from a shortage of funds. In this regard, he is asking for additional capital in the amount of 27,000 PHP to buy farm supplies and for payment of labor costs for those who plow and plant his corn field. In this way, he could improve his corn field and make it more productive.

He hopes that his income will increase, allowing him to send his children into higher levels of education and improve their living condition.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and for payment of labor costs for those who plow and plant his corn field

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 47 years old.  He is married and has two children who attend college.  With his family's support and encouragement, he has been managing his farming business well. He plants and harvests rice for future selling to the traders in the village. He has been cultivating his one-hectare rice field for five years. Danilo is not yet an expert in this kind of work and needs to improve his farming practices.

Danilo is now asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy pesticides and insecticides used in farming.  According to him, rice farming depends upon the climate and on how to manage the rice field well.   In the future, Danilo aims to provide a better living for his family.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Huruma B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Huruma B group in Western Kenya! Alice is the facilitator of the Huruma B group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Alice takes care of 10 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had a very good maize yield, harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alice was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Alice will educate her children and ensure food security.

In 2012, the members of Huruma B group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Alice with her group members; standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Frangky

texts.en:
Frangky is a 33-year-old widower who is living with his son, Farel, four years old.  Frangky owns a broiler business. He learnt how to run the business from his father. His family is known as broiler entrepreneurs in the village. Frangky was entrusted to continue the business after his father died. He has been running the business for 10 years  
 
Six months ago, Frangky suffered losses as hundreds of chickens died. But this situation did not stop him to keep running the business. Frangky is planning to purchase 5 boxes of chicks, feed, vaccines and vitamins. Therefore, he is seeking a loan amounting to IDR 8,000,000 from TLM. Frangky is hoping that TLM will assist him in improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase 5 boxes of chicks, feed, vaccines, and vitamins.

loans.name: Elina

texts.en: Elina is 37 years old and married to a businessman. They both have 8 children between the ages of 4 and 10. She has spent 12 years in the business of selling cassava. Elina has requested the loan to buy cassava to sell. With the profits, she will pay school fees for her children. In the future, she would like to have a vehicle to help in transporting cassava from the plantation to the marketplace.

loans.use: To buy more cassava to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 43 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has five children.

Juliet works in the fish industry and sells/catches fish for living. She has been doing this for twenty years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more fish to sell.

Juliet has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida de 31 años de edad, es viuda pero tiene 2 hijos, pedro de 11, y jazmín de 2 añitos de edad. Juntos habitan en su propia casa, ubicada en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. 
Desde muy joven, Zenaida se ha dedicado a las labores agrícolas, hace un año perdió a su querido esposo a causa de una enfermedad, es así que desde entonces tuvo que hacerse cargo de los quehaceres del campo juntamente con 2 peones quienes le facilitan en las faenas diarias. Por otro lado posee un campo campestre donde expende platos típicos de la región a base de pescado. Zenaida esta orgullosa por lo que hasta ahora viene logrando gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación constante. En un futuro desea ampliar su campro recreacional, ya que con lo poco que tiene no llega a satisfacer al cliente. Este será su cuarto credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete otra vez más en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la ampliación de su centro recreacional campestre.
texts.en:
Zenaida, 31, is a widow with two children, Pedro, 11, and Jazmín, 2.  They live in their own house in the the center of the village of Canayre in the district of Llochegua.

From a very early age Zenaida has worked in agriculture.  A year ago she lost her beloved husband due to illness so she had to take over managing the field with two workers who take care of the daily work.  She also has a rural center where she sells regional dishes made with fish.  Zenaida is proud of what she has been able to accomplish thanks to her hard work and constant dedication.  

In the future she would like to expand her recreational center since she does not quite have everything customers demand.  This is her fourth loan through MFP and she is committed to paying it back on time.  The 2,500 PEN loan will be used to expand the rural recreational center.

loans.use: To expand her rural recreational center.

loans.name: Meruzhan

texts.en: Meruzhan lives in the frontier village Gandzakar of Tavush region. Meruzhan is farming and he cares and works in his farm a lot despite also being employed at the village municipality. Meruzhan is not alone in farming works; he wife is a teacher and she works at the village school and after work greatly helps her husband about their farm. They have a son and a daughter and both of them are students.  In the farm Meruzhan has a pig, piglets, bee hives and a lot of chickens. He mentions that his farm’s honey is very famous and even from city people come to buy particularly his farm’s honey and he also sells meat and eggs. Meruzhan mentions that poultry is profitable occupation but swine breeding will bring more income and with great hope he decided to have this new activity with the help of Kiva support; this loan of 300.000 Armenian drams he asks for the purchase of a pig and also fodder for all his farm pigs.

loans.use: for the purchase of a pig and also fodder for all his farm pigs

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther T. is a mother of three, Esther lives with her husband who is a businessman. She joined Life in Africa in October 2004. She is a very talented designer especially gifted with tie and dye and, also makes awesome crafts. Her tie and dye fabrics are much sought after especillay by African women. Esther also works at Life in Africa with the invisible children bracelet project as a bracelet producer. she does earn an income that can help with the house expenses. Esther's challenge is that after making her tie and dye products, she needs to ask some one with a sewing machine to help her sew her beautiful into garments so she can put them up for sale. She then has to pay for this service by the sewing machine owner. If only she had her own machine, she would be producing lots good quality garments. This is the reason why she now seeks a loan in the amount of 800,000/= so she can have her own machine and buy materials to do this work without her having to pay for the service. This will also enable her to do her work much faster and more attention will be paid to it. Esther will be able to pay back this money in 12 months. Below is her budget:

Sewing machine 400,000/= Material cloth 200,000/= Rent 150,000/= Contingencies 50,000/= Total 800,000/=

WE Team to benefit: Education

loans.use: Purchasing a sewing machine and Tie & Dye Fabrics.

loans.name: Yanina

texts.en:
Yanina is married with one son. After completing schooling, both she and her husband were unable to find good paying jobs due to high unemployment rates in Ukraine. The family was forced to look for other sources of income to provide for their needs. Yanina’s husband went abroad in search of work. Yanina had always wanted to be self-employed so she decided to start her own business selling women’s lingerie. She has been in this business for about a year. Her polite manner and natural cheerfulness have helped Yanina generate clientele and operate her business successfully. Loans from “Nadiya Ukraine” have been a big help as she’s established and begun to expand her business. To meet growing demand from her customers, Yanina is requesting a loan of $500 which will allow her to purchase more silk, cotton and linen underwear at wholesale prices. Her goal is to increase her turnover capital which will allow her to purchase additional merchandise at affordable prices. Good quality women’s lingerie at discounted prices will attract many potential customers and boost Yanina’s sales promoting the consistent growth of her business and providing stable income for her family.

Яніна – одружена, в неї один син. Після університету вона та її чоловік не могли знайти гарно оплачувану роботу через високий рівень безробіття в Україні. Отже, вони були змушені шукати інші джерела прибутку для того, щоб забезпечити потреби родини. Чоловік Яніни поїхав за кордон в пошуках заробітку. Яніна вирішила працювати на себе, почала власний бізнес з продажу білизни для жінок. Вона займається цим бізнесом вже десь рік. Її ввічливість та природна жвавість допомогли Яніні знайти свого покупця та досягти успіху в бізнесі. Позики від „Надії України” також сприяли поступовому розвитку та розширенню її бізнесу. Для того, щоб задовольнити зростаючий попит, Яніна просить про позику в 500 доларів. Ці кошти дадуть їй змогу придбати більше білизни з шовку, бавовни та льону за оптовими цінами. Яніна планує збільшити робочий капітал та придбати більше товару за помірним цінами. Якісна жіноча білизна за низькими цінами привабить багато нових потенційних покупців та сприятиме зростанню темпів продажу, що, в свою чергу, забезпечить стабільний ріст бізнесу Яніни та допоможе отримати додаткові прибутки.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Taualagi

texts.en: Taualagi S. is forty-two years old.  She is married and has five children.  She tends a vegetable farm with her husband and children.  Taualagi works daily from morning until evening to make her garden productive.  This is the main source of income for this large family, and Taualagi is anxious to invest further in the family business.  She equates a loan to their business as an investment in her children’s futures.  She is applying for a loan to purchase additional seeds to expand the variety of vegetables that she raises.  She thinks expanding her variety and supply will help her attract a set of customers.

loans.use: Buy seeds, gardening tools

loans.name: Kibriyo

texts.en: Kibriyo I. is 50 years old, married, and has 4 children and 3 grandchildren. Her husband works as a mechanic. Her dream was to become a dressmaker, so after she finished school, she entered the technical college, and was educated to be a dressmaker.  She has been working as a dressmaker for 15 years and has 5 employees.  She sews various dresses for men and women. She would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase new kinds of material

loans.name: Blanca  Azucena

texts.es:
My name is Blanca P., I bake and sell tortillas. I have run this business from my home for four years. All my customers live in my neighborhood I sell them tortillas in the first part of the day and, in the afternoon, I continue to sell them around the colony. This business helps me pay for my family expenses and my children's education. Currently, I need to purchase corn, lime and milk to cover demands for the next months - I have nothing left in stock at this time.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Mi nombre es Blanca P., me dedico a la hacer tortillas y a la venta. este negcoio lo tengo hace 4 años en mi casa. Mis clientes son todos los de la comunida, las tortillas la genta las compra en mi negocio o yosalgo por la tarde a vender por la colonia. Con este negocio me ayuda para poder a portar a mi familia con los castos mensuales y estuidoos de mis hijos. ahora necesito comprar mas maiz, cal y lecha para estos meses ya que me he quedado sin producto.

loans.use: Compra de maiz, lecha, cal, sal.

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Everyone is impressed by Ms. Ngo Thi T.’s clothes and toy shop at Phu Cuong market. We cannot believe such a young woman can be the owner of this big shop. Ms. T.’s business has been really good because of its ideal location, and her natural talent in sales. All goods are often sold out really quickly. Her monthly income is about 250USD. At the age of 26, Ms. T. became a member of TYM Fund. It is also the year when she had her first child. Although the baby kept her busy, she never misses any group’s activity. Also, she is always willing to help other needy members of TYM Fund. Ms. T. thinks that winter is coming, there will be an increasing demand for warm clothes such as sweaters or leather jackets. She would like to borrow 1200USD to buy more clothes for her shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Thật ngạc nhiên khi đứng trước cửa hàng kinh doanh hàng may mặc sẵn và đồ chơi trẻ em của chị Ngô Thị Tình tại cổng chợ Phú Cường. Chúng tôi không nghĩ rằng người phụ nữ còn khá trẻ và nhỏ nhắn này lại là chủ một cửa hàng lớn như vậy. Việc kinh doanh của chị Tình đang tiến triển rất thuận lợi vì cửa hàng của chị nằm ở một vị trí khá lý tưởng, một phần nữa là do duyên bán hàng của chị nên hàng nhập về luôn được bán hết. Thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng từ cửa hàng khoảng 250 USD. Chị Tình tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 2002 khi 26 tuổi, đó cũng là năm chị sinh đứa con đầu lòng. Mặc dù có con nhỏ nhưng mọi hoạt động của nhóm, cụm chị đều tham gia rất nhiệt tình, sôi nổi, không những thế chị còn rất sẵn lòng giúp đỡ các chị em khác khi gặp khó khăn. Chị tâm sự rằng sắp đến mùa đông, có thể có những đợt rét đậm kéo dài nên đồ chống rét như len, dạ, áo jacket sẽ rất chạy hàng. Chị rất muốn được vay thêm 1200 USD để tích luỹ hàng cho thời gian tới.

loans.use: Buy winter garment

loans.name: Elais

texts.en:
Elais is a small entrepreneur who owns a small shop selling charcoal. She is married and has two children ages 5 and 7 years. Elias is a very hard worker, and she believes that one day she can change her family's living standard through business. She is asking for a loan to buy a scale to weigh charcoal. She is proposing to repay the loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

loans.use: To buy a scale to weigh charcoal.

loans.name: Shakar Allah

texts.en: Shakar Allah lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and lives with his own family. He is an educated and very talented boy. He is a shopkeeper with a retail shop which opened one year ago. During this year he has attracted a lots of clients but he was unable to complete his stock so he has requested an individual loan to expand his business. He hopes to make good a income and help his family.

loans.use: To expand his business and complete his stock

loans.name: Nankulabye A(V) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for seven months. Nulu has a beauty salon. She wants to use the extra profits to buy a steamer. Rose and Teddy have bar businesses and want to use the loan to purchase more furniture. Juliet sells charcoal and wants to expand the business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more salon equipment.

loans.name: Saidniso

texts.en:
M. Saidniso, 41 years old, is married with four children.

Saidniso has been selling colorful plastic bags for 2 years in the central market. Her customers are mainly the people purchasing goods in the market.  This stable business generates significant income for the family. 

Saidniso requests a loan of $600.00 for the term of 9 months. The funds are needed to increase the range of goods for sale. Saidniso is grateful to all lending to her and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: To increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata started her business at the age of 21. She is now married with 3 children. Her husband is a police officer, but his income is insufficient to meet family expenses. Fatmata’s business plays a crucial role in supplementing the family income.

With previous loans from SMT, she expanded her business and paid her children’s school fees. Her good repayment record has enabled her to request an individual loan, which she will use to complete the construction of their family home.

loans.use: To complete the construction of a successful business woman's family home

loans.name: Hebert

texts.es:
Mr. Hebert is a very humble person who repairs cars, especially changing tires and selling tire lubricants. He is a mechanic. He has worked in this business for many years; his work is well known and sought after. He and his wife have put forth a lot of effort to make this business and their family get ahead. Today, he needs more financing in order to purchase more lubricants and auto oil since the quantity of cars that transit the area is very large and promising. Finally, as a client of ours, Mr. Hebert has demonstrated a lot of responsibility and commitment with himself and others; this can be seen in the excellent credit history he maintains.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Hebert es una persona muy humilde que se dedica a reparar automoviles, en especial el cambio de llantas y la venta de lubricantes para los mismos, Él es mecanico. Trabaja en este negocio hace muchos años, su trabajo es muy bien conocido y solicitado, Él junto a su esposa, se han esforzado bastante para sacar este negocio y su familia adelante. Ahora necesita de mas financiamiento para poder comprar mas lubricantes y Aceite para automoviles ya que la cantidad de automoviles que transitan por la zona es muy grande y prometedora. Por ultimo, el Señor Hebert como cliente nuestro ha demostrado mucha responsabilidad y compromiso consigo mismo y con los demas, esto se puede ver en el excelente historial que tiene.

loans.use: Will purchase oil for his business

loans.name: Atsou Koffi

texts.fr:
Born on August 30, 1963 in Tsévié in the Zio Prefecture, Mr. Atsou Koffi H. trained as a welder, a trade he learned after leaving high school. He is married and the father of two children. His wife, who sells toothpicks and the like, is barely able to help him with the family expenses as she makes very little money from her business. In addition to his children, he also has apprentices to take care of. Honest, dynamic and skilled at his work, he is an excellent entrepreneur and manages his workshop well. To carry out his work proficiently and make it profitable, he is requesting a loan so that he can acquire a buff wheel and buy other equipment for his work. This will enable him to better satisfy his customers and develop their loyalty.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 30 août 1963 à Tsévié dans la Préfecture du Zio, monsieur H. Atsou Koffi est soudeur de formation, métier qu’il a appris après avoir abandonné ses études secondaires. Marié, il est père de deux (2) enfants. Sa femme, revendeuse de cure dent et autres, l’aide à peine dans les dépenses de la famille, car elle tire très peu de revenu de son commerce. En plus de ses enfants, il a en charge des apprentis. Honnête, dynamique et maîtrisant bien son métier, il est un excellent entrepreneur et gère bien son atelier. Pour accomplir efficacement son travail et rentabiliser ce dernier, il sollicite un crédit qui servira à acquérir une meule et à acheter d’autres matériels de travail. Ceci lui permettra de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et de la fidéliser.

loans.use: To buy a buff wheel and new work equipment

loans.name: Aracelly Petronila

texts.es:
Mrs. Aracelly is 33 years old and lives in the Concepción neighborhood of San Juan. She is married, and has two children, ages 6 and 11, in school. Her husband works in the Ministry of Health, and contributes towards the expenses of the family.

Aracelly's business is raising pineapple. She has nine years of experience in cultivation and began the business through her own labors. She needs this loan to buy agricultural supplies to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Aracelly tiene 33 años de edad, habita en el barrio la Concepción -San Juan, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 6 y 11 años de edad que están estudiando, su esposo trabaja en el minsa y aporta al gastos de la familia. El negocio de doña Aracelly es la producción de piña y lleva nueve años en el cultivo e inició con esfuerzos propios. El préstamo lo requiere para comprar insumos agrícolas para mejorar la producción.

loans.use: Adquisición de abonos para aplicárselos a su cosecha de piña

loans.name: Sailigul

texts.ru:
Sailigul A. lives in the Yavan town. She is 39 years old. She is married and has a son. They have a small and strong family. Her main occupation is sales. She owns a place on a market. She sells parts and accessories for cell phones. She had been in this business for the last 5 years. In addition, she works in "Airregistry" as a bookkeeper. She would like to renew her inventory, and for this reason, she wants to obtain a loan for 6 months. This will give her an opportunity to attract new customers and increase profits.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Амирхонова Сайлигул проживает в городе Яван. Занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку на рынке города. Торгует запасными частями для мобильных телефонов. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 5 лет. Кроме того работает в аэрокассе , бухгалтером. Хочет обновить ассортимент товара , поэтому хочет получить кредит сроком на 6 месяцев. Это даст ей возможность привлечь новых клиентов м увеличить прибыльность дела.Сайлигуль 39 лет. Живет с мужем и сыном. У них маленькая и дружная семь

loans.use: To increase inventory assortment

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is 40 years old, divorced, with a 12-year-old child. She has sold khanga (clothes) and coconuts since 2005. She works from 7am to 6pm and earns a monthly profit of about $90.

Salama is seeking a loan to buy more khanga and coconuts.

loans.use: To buy more khanga and coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Dado

texts.fr: Dado A. est âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de riz au marché de Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite avec ce premier crédit de FECECAV augmenter la taille de son activité en achetant des sacs de riz, des bidons d’huiles et d’autres condiments nécessaires dans la restauration du riz. Ceci lui permettra de mieux gagner pour répondre aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Dado A., 45, is married and the mother of 5 children. She sells cooked rice at the market of Adeta, a village situated about 150 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She hopes with this first loan through FECECAV to expand the size of her business by buying sacks of rice, jerry cans of oil and condiments necessary for selling cooked rice. This will allow her to earn more so as to better support her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing sacks of rice, jerry cans of oil, and condiments necessary for selling cooked rice

loans.name: San Antonio De Padua Group

texts.en:
Victoria D. L. C., Benigna DomitiL. C. C., and Felicitas L. D. L. C. are members of the community bank San Antonio D. Padua, in a small town called Mauallasacc in Ayacucho. The residents of the area are dedicated to agriculture, cheese production, and raising cattle.

Victoria is a single mother with a 20-year-old son who is currently studying at the University of Alas Peruanos. She helps run a restaurant that offers all types of Peruvian dishes. Her dream is to have her own restaurant and open a small store in the area. She is saving because the interest she earns continues to grow, and she plans to use the money to open her own store in the future.

Benigna lives with her partner and their 4 children, who are all in school. She has a small snack bar in the area. She hopes to open her own small restaurant in December 2008. She is currently saving to purchase more materials to stock her future restaurant and for her knitting business.

Felicitas is married with four children, aged 26, 22, 16, and 12. Felicitas has been selling candies since she was young, and she has now begun selling children's clothing. Her dream is to have her children become professionals. She is very proud that her two eldest are studying at the university in Ayacucho--they are on their way. She is currently saving to ensure they remain in school and to supply her future needs.

Felicitas will invest this loan by purchasing more clothing to sell. Benigna plans to purchase groceries to stock her snack bar, along with yarn because she also spends time knitting. Victoria will invest in her business by purchasing drinks and groceries to keep her restaurant stocked with food.

loans.use: The community bank, San Antonio de Padua, needs a loan of 4700 nuevos soles in order for 10 of its members to improve their businesses.

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr:
Madame A. Améyo est née le 04 février 1875 à Attitogon, dans la Préfecture des Lacs. Mariée et mère de 02 enfants, elle vend des tapettes et sandalettes et des habits pour enfants au marché d’Adétikopé, village dans lequel il vit actuellement. Dynamique et entreprenante, elle contribue aux besoins de sa famille grâce aux revenus que la procure ses activités qu’elle gère bien

Elle sollicite un crédit pour l’achat d’autres modèles d’habits, des chaussures et autres pour renforcer son commerce et augmenter ses revenus. Ainsi pourra-t-elle participer davantage à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Améyo A. was born on February 4, 1975 in Attitogon, in the Lakes Prefecture. Married and the mother of two children, she sells flip-flops and sandals as well as clothing for children in the open-air market of Adétikopé, the village where she presently resides. Dynamic and business-minded, she helps support her family, thanks to the income that her business brings in.

She is asking for a loan to purchase other styles of clothing, shoes, etc. to bolster her business and increase her earnings. In that way, she will be able to do more to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of children's shoes and clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Mukangamije

texts.en:
"Amakuru!" ("Hello!") from E. in Rwanda. E. is 47 years old, and the widow of three children.

E. started her business in 2005. With borrowed capital of 150,000 Frws from a family friend, she started a mini supermarket selling items such as: rice, powdered milk, cooking oil, Colgate, rice, maize flour, cassava flour, etc. She has currently employed one person to help with her business.

Because of her business, she has been able to send her three children to school. The eldest is currently studying at University and the younger two are in high school. Her long-term plan is to have all her children complete University.

She is looking for a loan of 500,000 Frws to increase her inventory in the supermarket. This loan would be repaid in 8 months.

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery tiene 46 años, vive con sus hijos y con su madre. Trabaja vendiendo productos de nutrición de una línea prestigiosa en su región, cada día acude a su establecimiento de ventas, al que llama “El club de la salud”,  para atender a sus vecinos, los cuales solicitan los productos que vende, este negocio le permite percibir ganancias suficiente para sostener a su familia, es por eso que atiende diariamente y por horas. Antes vendía desde su casa, pero gracias a sus ahorros logró obtener los medios necesarios parra arrendar un local.
