Es la primera vez que Mery solicita un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual con sus pagos. La cantidad que solicita será invertida en la compra de más productos y de esa manera aprovechar la demanda de esta época del año.
texts.en:
Mery is 46 years old and lives with her children and her mother. She sells nutrition products from a prestigious company in her area. Everyday she goes to her business, which is called "El club de la salud" (The health club), to attend to her neighbors who buy her products. This business helps her earn enough to support her family and she serves her clients daily and by appointment. She used to sell from her home, but thanks to her savings she was able to obtain the necessary means to rent a business space. This is the first time Mery is applying for a loan with MFP and she is committed to being on time with her payments. She will invest this loan in the purchase of more products in order to take advantage of the increased demand during this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba S. is a 29-year-old woman. She is married but has no children. She lives with her husband in her matrimonial home, in a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Abiba is an achiever and a resourceful woman. She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living.

Abiba has been trading bananas in Abofour market for four years. She treks to surrounding villages in the Central part of Ghana to purchase bulk stock of bananas from farmers and to retail to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to pick up enough stock to make enough profit to support her family. Abiba will buy the unripe banana in bulk, and she will cover it with plantain leaves in the bush. This would be there for a while so when it is ripe she would go for them and retail to her customers.

With the loan, she wants to purchase a bulk supply of bananas to enable the scale-up of her sales. She believes the loan would enable her to save more income to support her business growth. Abiba belongs to a village bank (loan group) called ‘Paul.’ She also hopes to receive GH¢600 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to support her husband in taking care of their home.

loans.use: To purchase a supply of bananas in bulk.

loans.name: 01-Đông Sơn Group

texts.vi:
Nhóm 01 thuộc phố 2 phường Đông Sơn- Thành phố Thanh Hoá cách Hà Nội 156 km về phía Nam. Nhóm gồm 6 thành viên do chị H. Thị Khuyên làm nhóm trưởng, năm nay chị 29 tuổi,chồng chị là anh Hiếu. Gia đình chị có bố mẹ già,bố chị bị ốm liệt giường vừa mới mất, tình hình kinh tế gia đình chị hiện nay rất khó khăn, anh chị có 1 con trai 3 tuổi. Chị vay mức vốn 3.079.800 VND(~177 USD) để buôn bán nước mắm, trang trải cuộc sống hàng ngày. Các thành viên trong nhóm đều có cùng mức vay.
*  Chị N. Thị Thanh, 64 tuổi, chị vay vốn mua nước mắm về bán.

 Chị Vũ Thị Toan, 47 tuổi, chị vay vốn mua nước mắm về bán.

*  Bác N. Thị Hằng, 61 tuổi, đầu tư vào ngành vận tải.

 * CHị N. Thị Hoe, 47 tuổi, vay vốn đầu tư vào mở hàng sửa chữa xe đạp và xe máy.

 * Chị N. Thị Minh , 41 tuổi, vay vốn đầu tư vào hàng bún chả, giò chả.
texts.en:
Group 01 lives in 2nd Street, Dong Son province, Thanh Hoa city, which is about 156 km south of Hanoi. Mrs. Hoang Thi Khuyen is the leader of Group 01 with five other members. She is 29 years old, and her husband's name is Hieu. They live with their parents. Her dad was very sick and just passed away. Her family is in such financial hardship. Mrs. Khuyen and Mr. Hieu have a son who is three years old. She wants to borrow 3,079,800 VND( approx. 177 USD) to sell fish sauce. Other members in her group also request the same amount of loan. - Mrs. Nguyen Thi Thanh, 64 years old, and Mrs. Vu Thi Toan, 47 years old, want to borrow money to sell fish sauce. - Mrs. Nguyen Thi Hang, 61 years old, borrows money for her transportation business. - Mrs. Nguyen Thi Hoe, 47 years old, wants to open a motorbike and bicycle repair shop. - Mrs. Nguyen Thi Minh, 41 years old, wants to invest in her rice vermicelli shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mua nước mắm, giò chả.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia N. is thirty-three years old. She is married and has three little kids who are in basic school. Afia lives with her husband and children in a community called Nkwaateng. Nkwaateng is in the Eastern Region of Ghana. A sizeable number of the inhabitants are engaged in farming activities. However, a quite appreciable number of women are involved in palm oil production. Afia is one of these women who actively produce palm oil. She has been in business for five years. Her husband is a food crop farmer.

She buys palm nuts from the farmers in her community; processes them in her house to produce the oil and sells it at wholesale prices to her customers. Palm oil is a local vegetable oil produced from palm fruit which has been cooked, pounded, sieved and boiled for hours. The reddish substance (the oil) is skimmed off and reboiled to expel its water content. Afia desires to use the loan to expand her business by buying palm fruit in bulk to be able to supply to more customers.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to scale up production to serve a larger market and eventually, help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Beauty Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure palm fruit in bulk

loans.name: Rahmonazar

texts.ru: Рахмоназар женат ему 42 года, у него есть 4 детей. Имеет высшее образование , но после рапсада Союза остался без работы.  Ему пришлось идти по стопам отца откармливать и продавать скот. Более 10 лет он занимается разведением скота. В бизнесе помогают дети, когда он уходит на работу . Он работает охранником в Железно дорожной станции. У него есть дойная корова, и поэтому его жене не приходиться покупать молоко. На кануне он продал молодого бычка, для покупки более зрелого, за которого дают хорошую плату, ему понадобилось большая сумма. Он обратился в Микроинвест, и был благодарен КИВА за поддержку.
texts.en:
Rahmonazar is 42 years old, married and has 4 children. He has a higher education, but he was left without work after the fall of the Soviet Union. He had to follow his father’s steps and started raising and selling livestock. He has been in this business over 10 years. Rahmonazar’s children help with the business when he leaves for work. He works as a security guard at a train station. Rahmonazar owns a dairy cow; this is why his wife does not need to buy milk. He recently sold a young bull in order to purchase a more mature one, which will earn him a good pay. However, Rahmonazar needed more money for the purchase. He requested a loan at MicroInvest and is grateful to Kiva for the support.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Leuk's Group

texts.en:
This loan request is from a small group of four people, all residents of Siem Reap province. Mrs Leuk S. has been selected to be the group leader by the members. S. owns a small shop selling soft drinks to her neighbors in her village. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver, and he also helps his wife transport products from the market to sell at their shop. They have four children who are students and still live in the family home. To earn additional income, Leuk S. has requested a loan to purchase a variety of soft drinks to sell in her store.

The other three borrowers are:
– K., who rents comfortable rooms to tourists for income, and needs a loan in order to fulfill her customers' requirements
– K., who sells breakfast food to the villagers, and has applied for a loan to buy her cooking ingredients
– S., a grocery seller looking for a loan to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks to sell in her shop

loans.name: Mumtaz Riaz Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz baji is the wife of R. M. and they have lived in the city of Lahore, Pakistan for 10 years.  Mumtaz baji says that she is not well educated because she didn’t pay as close attention to her studies as she did to knitting and sewing clothes, a skill which she learned from her mother.  Mumtaz baji is the mother of three sons and all of her children are enrolled in the local neighborhood school.  Mumtaz baji pays their school fees from the money she earns from her knitting business. Her husband runs a sanitary supplies selling business and has done so for 10 years now.  Mumtaz baji successfully repaid her first two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now she is applying for a loan to buy sanitary supplies like pipes and taps to help expand her husband’s sanitary business.

Mumtaz baji is the leader for this group loan which includes four other women from her locality.  The loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  Bushra begum baji wants a loan to buy and sell sand. Safia baji will buy more products for her grocery store.  Nasreen baji plans to replace the body of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle), and Bashiran baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business.  The members of a group loan mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy sanitary supplies like pipes and taps.

loans.name: Sakina Muhammad Hussain Group

texts.en:
Naheed baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes selling business.

T. baji wants a loan to buy shoe boxes to sell.

Sakina baji is the wife of M. H. and has lived in a city named Kasur, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Kasur city is famous for its sweet meat. Her husband belongs to a dairy business. Presently, they have one buffalo at their home and Sakina baji takes care of it. They both get up at 4 o'clock and get milk from the buffalo, then Mr. H. goes to the milk shops and sells the milk to them and earns income. Now they both are planning to buy another buffalo to expand their dairy business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for their dairy business.

loans.name: Bùi Thị

texts.en:
C. Bùi Thị (14200816668) is a 38 year-old female living in the town of Quảng Xương.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, C. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising raising ducks for sale.  C. has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 1,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, C. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities.  C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  C. is requesting a new loan of 8,000,000 VND to be used towards the purchase of breeding livestock.  This will be the 2nd loan taken out by C. from TYM Fund.  C. plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Tautautasi

texts.en: Tautautasi N., 25, is married with 4 children.  She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public 6 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 550 Tala (about US $229).  SPBD loans are Tautautasi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel K. is 33 years old and married to Milka Muthoni. Together they have two school-aged children. Daniel has been in the motorcycle taxi business now for two years. He was introduced to KADET by a friend of his and has so far taken three loans from the institution. He bought his first motorcycle with the first loan, used the second loan to repair and service the motorcycle, and now he wants to use the third loan to buy another motorcycle. The new motorcycle will allow him to grow his business and create employment for someone else; that person will rent the new motorcycle from him and operate it. Daniel's ambition is to move from just owning motorcycle taxis to owning an automobile taxi service in future. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle for his business

loans.name: Ausebia

texts.en:
Ausebia is a member of the Twiga borrower group in Kola, Morogoro. She is a 22-year-old woman. She is separated from her husband.

Nine years ago, Ausebia started her own cafe where she sells food, such as chapati. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 200,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Ausebia's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requested 150,000 Tsh to buy ingredients like wheat and cooking oil. With the additional profit she gains from the use of her loan funds, Ausebia hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more wheat and cooking oil

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
G. Rano is 41 years old and comes from a large but humble family. She is married and the loving mother of two children. Her father's hard and demanding character showed her, from the time she was a little girl, the significant value of work, and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life. Now Rano dedicates herself to raising and selling cattle, and with the income she generates, she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy and have become her best friends.

Rano is asking for a 4000 Somoni loan in order to buy more young cattle to later sell when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life. Let’s support this dedicated mother's proposal.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves in order to expand the business

loans.name: Juana Carmen

texts.en:
Juana, a 51-year-old separated woman, has one son who has finished university. She continues to sell lunch specials, but now to more clients, including a group of students that have come from different provinces in Peru to study at the University of San Marcos in Lima. She also sells lunches to the administrative personnel of the university. Juana needs a new loan of 1000 soles to buy an electric fryer and two rice pots. Juana wants to have her own tire shop. She is saving and is confident that she will succeed in fulfilling her dream. Juana is a member of The Orchids village bank.

Previous loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=108858

loans.use: To buy an electric fryer and two rice pots

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie S. is from the village of Catarman. She is 58 years old and married. To make a living, Jessie owns and operates a business venture, raising cattle for sale. Jessie has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2003, Jessie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. Her aim was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Jessie has successfully repaid her loast loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional animals. Jessie is now requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the twelfth loan taken out by Jessie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her livestock raising business

loans.name: Bibi Sabo Kweta Group

texts.en: Bibi Sabo Kweta is the group leader of Bibi Sabo Kweta group. There are four members in this group. They are wants to take a loan for expanding business and make it larger. So they are requested a group of loan 28000 Afghani. Baren Sabo wants to take a loan for her husband who has fuel selling shop. Hameda wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring. Kweta wants to take a loan for her brother who has metal working shop. Samera wants to take a loan for her husband who his taxi driver. They  thank AFS and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For expanding business

loans.name: Juana Micaela

texts.es: Doña Juana Micaela C. T. es originaria del paraje Chocolet, Canton Chiyax Totonicapan y ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, ese trabajo los ha venido realizando desde varios años y por medio del mismo a logrado sobre salir con sus hijos porque le genera un ingreso para darles de que comer a sus hijos, ella se ha dado cuenta que gana bien,por tal razon necesita un credito para poder ampliar su capital y asi comprar mas animales siempre lo realiza con la ayuda de sus pequeños, creemos que es factible darle el credito porque es una persona que admira a los demas y no se quere quedar con lo poco que tiene si no quiere crecer hasta ser una persona de mayor exito y demostrarle a las demas que sioendo mujer si pueder trabajar sin tener estudio.
texts.en:
Doña Juana Micaela C. T. is from Chocolet, Canton Chiyax Totonicapan, and she raises pigs. She has been doing this work for a number of years and through it she and children have managed to make a successful living because she earns enough of an income to be able to feed her children. Juana realizes that she earns a decent salary, and for that reason she is requesting a loan to increase her capital and buy more animals. She is always able to do her job with the help of her little ones. We believe that it should be possible to grant her a loan as she is a person who respects others, and she does not want to remain with the little that she has; rather she would like to grow to become a very successful person and show others that women without a formal education are still able to work.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital Growth

loans.name: Erickson

texts.es:
Erickson es un joven soltero de 23 años, vive en la casa de sus padres. En vista que es el hermano mayor ha tomado la responsabilidad de apoyar a sus hermanos menores. Él siembra café, plátanos y frijol en las chacras de sus padres. Realizar estos trabajos agrícolas le agradan mucho y más cuando trabaja con toda su familia; mientras su madre va prepara los alimentos, su padre y su hermanos lo ayudan con el macheteo, y así también durante las cosechas, de ese modo no siente pesada su labor. 
Al ver Erickson que sus hermanos le ayudan se siente motivado, y con mucho gusto comparte sus ganancias con ellos.
Pero sus anhelos a futuro son de independizarse y tener sus propios cultivos, y mejor aún si logra comprar sus propias tierras.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y está muy agradecido por contar con tal apoyo, por lo cual hace un juramento de no defraudar a su grupo con el incumplimiento de sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para el abonado de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Erickson is a young single man, 23 years old, who lives with his parents in their home. Given that he is the oldest brother, he has taken the responsibility of helping to support his younger siblings. He plants coffee, bananas and beans on his parents’ farmlands. He enjoys carrying out these agricultural tasks, and appreciates them even more when he gets to work with his whole family. While his mother prepares the meals, his father and brothers help him clear land. They also help during harvest time and therefore, during these times, he doesn’t feel the arduousness of the work as much. Seeing his siblings pitch in motivates Erickson, and he shares his earnings with them with great pleasure. However, his future plans are to become independent and have his own crops, which would be even better if he could manage to purchase his own lands. This is his first loan with MFP, and he is very thankful to have such support, for which he promises not to defraud the group by failing to make any payments. The funds he is requesting will help him buy fertilizers for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.es: Alba Marina es una mujer que tiene 4 hijos, ella se dedica a una librería, hace más de 31 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que le ayudo muchos cuando sus hijos tenían que recurrir a clases, pero hasta los momentos ha logrado mantenerlo ya que este es su medio de vida y lo que le ha ayudado a soportar esta difícil situación. Además no es la primera vez que solicita crédito en Fundación pues ya lo había hecho y pagaba sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para cuadernos, marcadores, papel bond, lapiceros, borradores entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Alba Marina is a woman with 4 children who has dedicated her time to running a book shop for more than 31 years. She had a lot of help when her children were in school, but until now she maintains the shop since it is how she makes her living, and has helped support her through a difficult situation. This is not the first time she has asked for a loan from Fundación, as she has had loans before and always made her payments on time. She is asking for financing for working capital to purchase notebooks, markers, bond paper, pens, erasers and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Reda

texts.en: Reda G. is currently in the business of selling cooked food in her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock sodas, beer, water, etc., to sell. Reda is 35 years old and is married to a driver. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a larger restaurant. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock sodas, beer, water, etc., to sell in her restaurant

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry P., 37 years old, is the father of two children. He is also a farmer and grows corn in Banga, South Cotabato Mindanao. Currently, he tills a 1-hectare corn field. His farm is doing well and he wants to make it more productive to augment his income.

He needs additional capital for his business. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP from the Kiva field partner, Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies. He will also pay the laborers who helped him prepare the soil before planting.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Rosas De Apaña Group

texts.es:
ROSAS DE APAÑA es un banco de emprendimiento formado por 10 integrantes de las zonas de Ovejuyo y Apaña, son personas que se dedican al comercio informal y otras actividades como el transporte, sus representantes fueron elegidos por voto en asamblea siendo elegida como presidenta la Sra Angelica que se dedica a la venta de comida, La tesorera Salome vende cosmeticos en distintas zonas, como secretario el Sr Oscar Que trabaja como transportista.

Forman parte de la base la Sra Elena Quien vende verduras, el Sr Victor es transportista, Eugenia  Vende Comida en su Kiosko, La Sra Evarista se dedica a la venta de verduras, y el Sr. Antonio es transportista, la Sra Carmen Basilia trabaja con el minibus de su esposo y la Sra Claudia que vende cosmeticos por catalogo. estas son las actividades que ellos desarrollan dia a dia para sostener a sus familias y usaran el prestamo par extender sus negocios y en otros casos empezar uno.						
						
Todos los integrantes estan agradecidos con Emprender  y  Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Rosas de Apaña” was started by ten members from the districts of Ovejuyo and Apaña. They engage in informal trade and other activities, such as providing transportation services. They voted in an assembly and elected Sra. Angelica as their president. She sells food. Salome is the treasurer and sells cosmetics in different areas. Sr. Oscar serves as the secretary and works as a transportation driver.

The other members of the group are: Sra. Elena – sells vegetables Sr. Victor – provides transportation services Eugenia – sells food from her kiosk Sra. Evarista – sells vegetables Sr. Antonio – provides transportation services Sra. Carmen Basilia – operates a minibus with her husband Sra. Claudia – sells cosmetics by catalog

These activities help them to develop day after day so that they can support their families. The members will use their loans to either expand existing businesses or start new ones. All of them are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in them by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase their operating capital

loans.name: Stama

texts.en:
Stama M. is 32 years old and married to a clerk. She has five school-aged children. Stama is currently in the business of selling posho and beans in a wholesale shop, and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans and posho to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, Stama hopes to be able to build rooms for renting.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of beans and posho to sell

loans.name: Marta Armando

texts.pt:
Marta Amando M. nasceu no Bairro da Machava, cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, tem 25 anos de idade, casada e mãe de3 filhos de 7, 4 e 1 anos de idade, o mais velho é que vai a escola. Fez somente4ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com familiares não sustenta mais ninguém para alem da sua família. 
Saiu de Macahava para Boane com os pais ainda jovem, porque estes tinham machambas agrícolas. Depois do casamento continuou a residir em Boane, onde desenvolve o seu negócio. Trabalha das 7:00h as 18:00h todos os dias, vende mais panelas que adquire por 5.000.00mt e vende por 8.500.00mt, não possui nenhum empregado. Deste negócio consegue um rendimento de cerca de 3.500.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 11.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material (chapas de zinco, pedra, cimento, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 3.100.00mt, 8.000.00mt e 10.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua residência adquirir um meio de transporte.
texts.en:
Marta Amando M. was born in the Machava district, city of Maputo, Maputo province. She is 25 years old, is married and has three children aged 7, 4, and 1. The eldest attends school. Marta only finished fourth grade; she couldn't continue for financial reasons. She lives in her own house with relatives and has no dependents other than her family. When Marta was young, she left Machava to move to Boane with her parents because they had machambas (small family farms). After her marriage she continued living in Boane, where she started her business. She works from 7:00 am until 6:00 pm everyday selling pots that she buys for 5,000 MZN and sells for 8,500 MZN. She has no employees. From this business she earns about 3,500 MZN per month, which she uses for household expenses and even manages to put something in the bank. Marta has never taken out loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients here. This is her fourth loan. She is asking for 11,000 MZN, with which she wants to buy materials (zinc sheets, stone, cement, sand and other materials) to continue building her house. Her previous loans were for 3,100 MZN, 8,000 MZN and 10,000 MZN, all for the same purpose. She promises to pay off this loan on time so she can receive more loans. In the future, she would like to ask for more loans so she can finish her house and buy some type of transportation.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria S. is 50-year-old married woman who lives in Bungyod Brgy 2, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living through her pig-fattening and general store businesses.

Together with Victoria’s husband, Romulo, and their 8 children (with some of them already working and having their own families while the others are still in school) they have been able to grow the business together as the children help out making it part of their daily chores.

Victoria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her general store and pig-fattening businesses. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 4,000 from her business activities.

Victoria is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 10,000 was used to fund operations for her general store and pig-fattening which had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 6th loan in the amount of Php 10,000, which she intends to use on her general store and pig-fattening. Victoria is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Gulbayra's Group

texts.ru:
Сагындыкова Гульбайра – лидер данной группы. Гульбайра уже достигла преклонного возраста, а именно ей уже пятьдесят лет. Однако Гульбайра не спешит на покой. Её трое детей давным давно взрослые люди. Старшый сын холост, работает в фирме в Бишкеке, а дочь замужем. Самый младший сын также пока не женат и работает в мебельном цехе. Имея таких детей любая мать предпочла бы сидеть дома и отдыхать. Но это не стихия Гульбайры, которая всю жизнь находиться и любит находиться в водовороте повседневной жизни, в труде. На данный момент она продаёт скот на скотном рынке. Гульбайра начала свой бизнес пять лет назад, когда она вместе с мужем откормили и продали одного бычка, а вырученные деньги пустили в оборот. Сейчас бизнесом занимается в основном сама Гульбайра, но постоянно пользуется поддержкой мужа. Муж Гульбайры работает в школе. И как у всех работников этой сферы у её мужа не совсем высокая зарплата. И благодаря деятельности Гульбайры им живётся довольно – таки неплохо. За эти годы Гульбайра достигла многого: купила участок земли под застройку в г. Бишкек (столица Кыргызстана), выдала дочь замуж. Её ежемесячный доход составляет около пяти тысяч сомов ($110). Гульбайра решила обратиться за кредитом, так как хочет купить двух бычков для перепродажи. В будущем она планирует женить сыновей, построить дом, и расширить бизнес за счёт увеличения поголовья скота. 

У Гульбайры четыре партнёра по группе:

Бейшембаевой Динаре тридцать семь лет. Она вдова. У Динары две дочери. Обе учатся в средней школе. Динара работает системным администратором в госрегистре. Динара хочет получть этот кредит и купить электропечь, DVD плейер и пылесос. 

Малчиевой Жаныл пятьдесят два года. Её супруг – специалист в Госрегистре. А сама Жаныл реализует товары в магазине. У Жаныл трое сыновей. Двое из них до сих пор живут с родителями. Жаныл надеется получить кредит и купить два мешка сахара для перепродажи. 

Кадыровой Ырысбубу шестьдесят семь лет. Ырысбубу и её муж – пенсионеры. Но современная жизнь показала, что человек при желании и воли может стать кем захочет в любом возрасте. Ырысбубу – бизнес леди. Она продаёт крупнорогатый скот и лошадей. Ей нужен кредит, чтобы купить трёх баранов.

Токомбаевой Болгонай пятьдесят пять лет. Болгонай вырастила шестерых детей. Все дети уже выросли и устроились в жизни. Болгонай до сих пор трудится. Она производт женскую трикотажную одежду на заказ. Она надеется получить кредит и купить тридцать мотков трикотажной нити.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Gulbayra S. is the leader of this group. She has reached an old age, and specifically, she is already fifty years old. However, Gulbayra is no hurry to rest. Her three children have become adults a long time ago. The oldest son is single and works at a company in Bishkek, and the daughter is married. The youngest son is also single and works at a furniture factory. Having such good children, any mother would have preferred to stay home and rest. But this is not Gulbayra’s calling. She spends and has spent her life in a water funnel of everyday life, in hard work. Currently, she sells livestock at the livestock market. Gulbayra started her business five years ago, when she and her husband fattened and sold one bull and put the profit into turnover. Now, Gulbayra is primarily involved in the business, but always uses her husband’s support. He works at a school. And just like many employees in this field, her husband’s salary is not high at all. Thanks to Gulbayra’s business, they live fairly well. Gulbayra achieved a lot over the years: bought a plot of land in Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan) to be used for construction, married off her daughter. Her monthly income is about five thousand som ($110). Gulbayra decided to request a loan because she wants to buy two bulls for resale. In the future, she plans to marry off her sons, build a house and expand the business by increasing the livestock headcount. Gulbayra has four partners in the group: Dinara B. is thirty-seven years old. She is a widow and has two daughters, both of whom attend school. Dinara works as a system administrator at the city registry. She wants to obtain this loan in order to buy an electric oven, DVD player and vacuum cleaner. Janyl M. is fifty-two years old. Her husband is a specialist at the city registry. And Janyl sells merchandise at a store. She has three sons, two of whom still live with their parents. Janyl wants to obtain the loan and buy two bags of sugar for resale. Yrysbubu K. is sixty-seven years old. She and her husband are retired. Current life, however, showed that a person with desire and will can become whoever she wants to be at any age. Yrysbubu is a businesswoman. She sells cattle and horses. She needs the loan to buy three sheep. Bolgonay T. is fifty-five years old. She raised six children, all of whom are grown and lead independent lives. Bolgonay still works. She makes women’s knitwear to-order. She hopes to obtain the loan and purchase thirty rolls of knit thread.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two bulls for resale

loans.name: United People Group

texts.en: Marie W. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called “United People”. She is 48 years old, is married, and has a 30-year-old child. Her responsibilities also includes a sibling. Marie did not have the opportunity to go school. In the photo, she is the one holding the sign. For 16 years, Marie has been selling foodstuffs such as oil, pepper, and seasonings at Congo Town, in the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She has good relationships with her customers whenever they come to buy, which keeps them returning. Marie plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more oil, pepper, and seasonings. Her goal is to grow her business into a shop. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more oil, pepper, and seasonings

loans.name: Effrene

texts.en:
Effrene T. is from the village of Midsapinit, Gingoog City. He is 42 years old. Effrene is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Effrene owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing cargo transport services to local community members. He uses his motorcycle to transport his neighbors' crops to the city. Effrene has been engaged in his business for over 12 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Effrene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Effrene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to repair his motorcycle. Effrene is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be his second loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Tukolerewamu Nanziga Group, Mpigi

texts.en:
30-year-old Alex M. exemplifies hard work in its essence. Like a lark he is an early riser, fully focused on what lies ahead in terms of gains in his business.

For three years, Alex has been giving a good account of himself running his dispensary in Nanziga, Mpigi. This happy-go-lucky married father of two has reached a satisfactory rate of progress in his business. With monthly proceeds of 70,000 shillings he has managed to give his two children a quality education.

Alex is planning on expanding his dispensary on the acquisition of this loan. He plans to buy more dispensary equipment and also to equip his clinic with enough drugs.

loans.use: To purchase dispensary equipment and new consignments of drugs

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en: Teddy is a single mother of one child and her child is still young. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She owns a charcoal store at home and sells to all categories of people. She buys this charcoal from her home and doesn’t incur any transport costs to and from shopping. She has been in this business for two years and with MCDT for five years. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. Besides this charcoal business, she also owns a small retail shop.  Her major customers are her neighbors. She works seven days a week.  Her business challenges include seasonality and when her customers who bought on credit take a long time to pay back. She aspires to own a restaurant. Teddy joined MCDT because she needed capital for her business. She  resides in and owns a two-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia C. is from the village of Piao, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 48 years old, married and has 6 adult and achool-aged children. Virginia owns & operates a farming business. Virginia has been engaged in her business for 18 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.


In 2008, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Virginia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.  



About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 



*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a farmer in western Kenya. He has been farming for 9 years.  He employs one farm hand on his mixed farm, where he produces milk from his dairy cows.  Geoffrey also draws some income from a retail shop he owns.

This will be his third loan from Juhudi, but both of his previous loans were smaller.  In 5 years, Geoffrey hopes to open a store to sell seeds.  He cites a lack of piped water as a significant business challenge.

Geoffrey is 28, and has three kids who are between 9 months and 3 years of age. He says this loan will allow him to provide for his family's basic needs, as well as to pay for his kids' school fees.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua A. sells vegetables, canned tomatoes, salted fish and groundnut (peanut) paste at Abura. She has received junior high education. She is married and has four children.

Efua has been selling vegetables and other food items for eight months. She supports her husband in taking care of her children. Her loan will be used to buy additional vegetables including other varieties of vegetables to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga S. is from the village of Mozzozzin Norte. She is 49 years old, married and has 8 school-aged children. Dominga owns & operates a manufacturing business, making & selling clay products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over 33 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Dominga joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be the third loan taken out by Dominga from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es: Emilio, de 63 años de edad, está casado y tiene una hija, Nidia de 12 años. Juntos residen en la comunidad de Villa Quintiarina, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. Emilio recuerda que durante varios años se dedicaba ayudar a sus padres, sembrando y cosechando cacao, pero con el tiempo tuvo su propia parcela de chacra en donde que sus padres le obsequiaron. Desde entonces empezó a trabajar en ello, produciendo cacao, asimismo se relacionaba con los compradores, por le que dio buen resultado la actividad que realiza. En la actualidad su producto de cacao está posicionado, y sus ventas se mantienen constantes, debido a la calidad y a la entrega eficaz que realiza con cada uno de sus clientes. Emilio trabaja con un peón, para que le facilite el cuidado de sus plantaciones de cacao y su rutina diaria es a partir de las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde. Paralelamente a esta actividad, tiene un restaurante donde expende comida hacia el público en general, negocio que esta a cargo su esposa. Su plan a futuro es acondicionar su restaurante, introduciendo nuevas mesa, sillas, equipos con la finalidad de que dar comodidad a sus clientes, de esa forma aumente sus ventas de manera considerable. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus obligaciones de pago, además todos los socios que conforman en su banco comunal, son responsables en los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas, carnes, verduras, ingredientes, para que pueda continuar preparando sus potajes típicos de la selva que gustan de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Emilio is 63 years old. He is married and has one daughter, Nidia, who is 12 years old. They live together in the community of Villa Quintiarina, located on the edge of the Peruvian jungle, where he has his own home built of wood. Emilio recalls that during a number of years he helped his parents, planting and harvesting cacao. Eventually he had his own farm plot that his parents left to him. Since then, he has worked the land, producing cacao as well as getting to know the buyers, which has produced good results. Currently his cacao product is well positioned and he has constant sales, due to the quality and the efficient work he performs for each of his customers. Emilio works with a laborer, who helps care for his cacao plants, and his daily routine is from 6 in the morning until 6 in the evening. He also has a restaurant where he sells tipical meals to the general public, which his wife runs. His plan for the future is to remodel his restaurant, adding new tables, chairs and equipment in order to provide greater comfort to his customers and, in this way, increase his sales considerably. This is his eighth loan with MFP, and he promises to continue meeting all of his payment obligations. Moreover all of the members who make up his communal bank are responsible with their payments. He will use this loan to purchase drinks, meat, vegetables, and ingredients so that he can continue preparing the typical jungle stews that his clients like.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and products to prepare typical stews

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en:
Augustin is 45 years old and married with six children between 6 and 18 years old. Augustin is a businessman and his wife is jobless. For that reason, he has to work hard to provide all the basic needs for his family. Augustin sells handbags and he said that is a good business because it is profitable. Augustin is well known and his business is well organized as well. This is his 15th year of successful operation in business. Augustin runs his business from 6 in the morning to 6 in the morning every day.

Augustin is now requesting a Kiva loan Via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing additional handbags to sell. This expansion will allow him to be more efficient and more successful. Once this loan is given, Augustin will be able to earn more profit to use for his family and his business.

loans.use: To purchase more handbags to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy rice, cassava, fish, meat, cooking oil, and so forth

loans.name: Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama CAMINO AL ÉXITO y se ubica en el Estado D. México.  Esta comunidad se distingue porque una D. las actividades productivas que predominan en el lugar es el D. L. agricultura y ganadería así como L. elaboración D. costuras y cuerdas D. plástico.  El grupo está conformado por  10 integrantes. 

L. Sra. BIBIANA VICTORIA V. D. es integrante D. este grupo.  ElL. es originaria D. L. comunidad D. San Pedro el Alto,  ha vivido en esta comunidad 44 años y se dedica a  L. elaboración D. cuerdas D. platicos (se utilizan como material deportivo en las escuelas; y también trabaja en el campo y cuando se requiere en labores domesticas con sus vecinos.  Sus clientes son las papelerías D. las comunidades vecinas, ya que L. Sra. las elabora y las venD. por docenas, además D. que elL. argumenta que L. clave o éxito D. su negocio se encuentra en que ha tratado D. tener siempre sus pedidos a tiempo.  Tiene 44 años, estudio L. primaria. Es casada y tuvo 6 hijos, en L. actualidad solamente 3 dependen D. elL., uno  D. ellos estudia L. preparatoria, uno L. secundaria y el otro L. primaria. Quiere este crédito para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio ya que tiene varios pedidos y desea comprar materia prima para seguir elaborando sus cuerdas. Y desea que con el préstamo su negocio se siga fortaleciendo.   L. Sra. Bibiana como L. conocen en su pueblo espera que con su trabajo su hijos sigan estudiando y puedan terminar una carrera profesional, ya que el crédito hasta ahora le ha servido para mantener su negocio siempre con mercancía, y lo que nos comenta, es que esto le ha dado L. oportunidad D. obtener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad D. vida para su familia. Piensa seguir en L. elaboración D. cuerdas pero a mayor escaL. y es por eso que con este préstamo que solicitó pueda tener mayor producción.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
NERI F. M. (VTA. D. DULCES)
ESPERANZA P. M. (COSTURAS)
MARIA M. P. (COMIDA)
TEOFIL. FREDESVINDA D. L. C. S. (VTA D. DULCES)
IRMA M. D. L. C. (VTA D. TORTILLAS)
MA. D. LOS ANGELES R. R. (VTA D. DULCES)
CECILIA G. M. (CRIA D. GUAJOLOTES Y POLLOS)
ENEDINA G. R. (VTA ROPA)
MARIA CECILIA  R. M. (CRIA D. BORREGOS)
texts.en:
This group is called ROAD TO SUCCESS and is located in Mexico. This community distinguishes itself because the predominant economic activities are farming and raising livestock, as well as making plastic rope. The group is comprised of 10 members. BIBIANA VICTORIA V. D. is one member of the group. She is originally from the San Pedro el Alto area, and has lived in this community for 44 years. She dedicates herself to making plastic cords (they are used for sports at the schools); she also works in the farmlands, and for her neighbors when they need domestic services. Her customers are the bookstores of the neighboring communities, since she makes and sells her product by the dozens. She comments that one of the reasons for her business’ success is the fact that she always has tried to have her orders ready on time. She is 44 years old, and finished primary school. She is married and has 6 children, of whom only 3 still depend on her. One of them is in preparatory school, one in secondary and the other in primary. She wants this loan to continue investing in her business, and to buy raw materials for several orders that she has pending. She hopes that the loan will continue to strengthen her business. Bibiana, as she is known in her town, hopes that her work will allow her children to continue their studies so they can become career professionals. The loans, until now, have helped her keep her business supplied with merchandise. In turn, her profits have allowed her to increase her income and proviD. a better quality of life for her family. She plans to continue making rope but in a grander scale, which is why she requests this loan to increase her production. The other members of the group are: NERI F. M. (VTA. D. DULCES) ESPERANZA P. M. (COSTURAS) MARIA M. P. (COMIDA) TEOFIL. FREDESVINDA D. L. C. S. (VTA D. DULCES) IRMA M. D. L. C. (VTA D. TORTILLAS) MA. D. LOS ANGELES R. R. (VTA D. DULCES) CECILIA G. M. (CRIA D. GUAJOLOTES Y POLLOS) ENEDINA G. R. (VTA ROPA) MARIA CECILIA R. M. (CRIA D. BORREGOS)

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To continue investing in her business (in raw materials for her plastic roping).

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 35-year-old married man. He is blessed with a four-year-old child who goes to school. He is a hardworking man who runs a retail shop. He also has a motorbike transport business to earn extra income. He has been able to improve his business using loans that he gets from Faulu Kenya. He has also learned how to save his money. With this loan of 70,000 Kenyan shillings, he will add stock of cooking fat, soda and maize flour. He hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To add stock of cooking fat, soda and maize flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for sowing corn
